sentences.text: 2016 PERFORMANCE HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS delivered strong financial and business performance in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights include the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total revenues were $4.2 billion, an increase of 50% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues before reimbursable items were $3.9 billion, an increase of 56.5% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Basic earnings per share (EPS) were $1.74, a decrease of 11.6% from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS from continuing operations was $2.81, an increase of 14.5% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, we completed the acquisition of TransFirst which was the largest acquisition in our history and it doubled the size of our merchant business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of authorizations and transactions processed during the traditional holiday shopping season were the highest in our history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS and revenues before reimbursable items are non-GAAP financial measures which are defined on page 25 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These two metrics and relative TSR were used as the performance metrics at the enterprise level for our executive compensation program for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program aligns to long-term shareholder value creation and attracts, motivates and retains an exceptionally talented executive team with the skills and vision required for us to become the leading global payment solutions provider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program links compensation to TSYS performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based pay incentives focus our management on achieving our key financial, strategic and business goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, approximately 85% and 74%, respectively, of our CEOs and, excluding a one-time cash signing bonus for our newly hired President and COO, other named executive officers target total direct compensation opportunity was performance-based, with the actual amounts realized dependent upon our annual and long-term performance and our stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based pay includes the target 2016 Annual Incentive Program (AIP) cash award and Long-Term Incentive Program (LTIP) opportunity (delivered in the form of stock options and performance shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Program Reflects Best Practices Including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasis on Performance-Based Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy on Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Provisions with Pro Rata Vesting of Equity Upon Change of Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of an Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Shareholder Say-on-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging of Company Stock and Restrictions on Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Backdating or Repricing of Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Excise Tax Gross-Up Policy for New Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Employment Agreements with Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were gratified that over 94% of the votes cast in 2016 on the advisory vote on our executive officers compensation voted
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in support of the compensation paid to executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, consistent with its strong interest in shareholder engagement, communication, and transparency, the Compensation Committee continued to examine our executive compensation program to assure alignment between the interests of our executive officers and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AND BOARD MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS is committed to good corporate governance, which is designed to build long-term shareholder value, sustain our success, maintain internal checks and balances and foster responsible decision making and accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines and other governance practices to provide a framework for the effective governance of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines and other governance practices are reviewed regularly by the Board and TSYS and modified as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full text of our Corporate Governance Guidelines, Code of Business Conduct and Ethics which is applicable to all directors, officers and employees, each committees current charter, procedures for shareholders and other interested parties to communicate with the independent Lead Director or with the non-management directors individually or as a group and procedures for reporting complaints and concerns about TSYS, including complaints concerning accounting, internal accounting controls and auditing matters can be found in the Corporate Governance section of our website at www.tsys.com, under Investor Relations then Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance is a continuing focus at TSYS, starting with the Board and extending to management and all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such the Board reviews TSYS policies and business strategies and advises and counsels the Chief Executive Officer and the other executive officers who manage our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that 10 of its 13 members are independent as defined by the listing standards of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) and our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS Board has determined that the following directors are independent: James H. Blanchard, Kriss Cloninger III, Walter W. Driver, Jr., Sidney E. Harris, William M. Isaac, Mason H. Lampton, Connie D. McDaniel, John T. Turner, Richard W. Ussery and James D. Yancey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gardiner W. Garrard, Jr. and H. Lynn Page, who retired as directors at the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, were also determined by the Board to be independent directors for the period they served as directors during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a director to be considered independent, the Board must affirmatively determine that the director has no direct or indirect material relationship with TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established guidelines for independence to assist it in determining director independence which are consistent with the independence requirements in the NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to applying these guidelines, which are set forth in Section 2 of our Corporate Governance Guidelines and available in the Corporate Governance section of our website at www.tsys.com, under Investor Relations then Corporate Governance, the Board considers all relevant facts and circumstances in making an independence determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considered the transactions described under Certain Relationships and Related Transactions on page 10 and concluded that none of the transactions impaired any directors independence under TSYS independence guidelines or NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors held seven meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All incumbent directors attended at least 75% of Board and committee meetings held during their tenure during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average attendance by directors at the aggregate number of Board and committee meetings they were scheduled to attend was 92%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although TSYS has no formal policy with respect to Board members attendance at its annual meetings, it is customary for all Board members to attend the annual meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors attended the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-management directors meet separately in executive session at least four times a year in conjunction with each regularly scheduled meeting of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors meet in executive session at least once a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent Lead Director presides at the meetings of non-management and independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James H. Blanchard currently serves as our independent Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS Board of Directors has five principal standing committeesan Audit Committee, a Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, a Compensation Committee, a Technology Committee and an Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Each committee has a written charter adopted by the Board of Directors that complies with the listing standards of the NYSE pertaining to corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the committee charters are available in the Corporate Governance section of our website at www.tsys.com, under Investor Relations then Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each member of the Audit, Corporate Governance and Nominating and Compensation Committees is an independent director as defined by the listing standards of the NYSE and our Corporate Governance Guidelines, and satisfies the applicable SEC and NYSE additional independence requirements for the members of such committees.

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the intervals between meetings of TSYS Board of Directors when the full Board is unable to meet in person or telephonically with respect to urgent, time sensitive matters, the Executive Committee possesses and may exercise any and all of the powers of the Board of Directors in the management and direction of the business and affairs of TSYS with respect to which specific direction has not been previously given by the Board of Directors unless Board action is required by TSYS governing documents, law or rule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Report of the Audit Committee is on page 21.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Committee are ndependent under the rules of the NYSE and the SEC, financially literate under the rules of the NYSE and that Connie D. McDaniel is an audit committee financial expert as defined by the rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of the Audit Committee include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring the integrity of TSYS financial statements, TSYS systems of internal controls and TSYS compliance with regulatory and legal requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selecting and monitoring the independence, qualifications and performance of TSYS independent auditor and internal auditing activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing an avenue of communication among the independent auditor, management, internal audit and the Board of Directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring the effectiveness of managements enterprise risk management process that monitors and manages key business risks facing TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying qualified individuals to become Board members;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommending to the Board the director nominees for each annual meeting of shareholders and director nominees to be elected by the Board to fill interim director vacancies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing the annual review and evaluation of the performance of the Board and its committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Developing and recommending to the Board corporate governance guidelines; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensuring that procedures are in place for annual CEO performance reviews and annual reviews for succession planning and management development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Report of the Compensation Committee is on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of the Compensation Committee include     Establishing, reviewing and approving the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer and reviewing and approving compensation amounts for all other executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing TSYS equity compensation plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preparing the report on executive compensation to be included in TSYS annual proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing and assessing potential risk to TSYS from its compensation practices, policies and programs; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring TSYS management development and executive succession planning activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees charter reflects these responsibilities and, except to the extent prohibited by NYSE rules or other applicable law or regulation, allows the Committee to delegate any matters within its power and responsibility to individuals or subcommittees when it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information regarding TSYS processes and procedures for the consideration and determination of executive compensation, including the roles of TSYS executive officers and independent compensation consultant in the Committees decision making process, can be found under Compensation Discussion and Analysis on page 24.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Technology Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of the Technology Committee include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assisting the Board and Audit Committee in their oversight of TSYS management of risks regarding technology, information security, disaster recovery and business continuity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing and discussing with management TSYS assessment and management of risks associated with its technology;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing and discussing with management TSYS risk appetite and strategy and objectives relating to technology risks, as well as the guidelines, policies and processes for monitoring and mitigating such risks and strategy and objectives: and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Making recommendations to the Audit Committee or the Board with respect to any of the above and other matters related to technology risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee periodically reviews and recommends to the Board the leadership structure of the Board including whether to separate or combine the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman positions as well as whether to have a Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws and Corporate Governance Guidelines provide the Board with the flexibility to change the structure of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer positions as and when appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, since 2003, our Corporate Governance Guidelines have required the election by the independent directors of an independent Lead Director to serve during any period when there is no independent Chairman of the Board in order to ensure that there is effective oversight by an independent board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes this structure provides an effective balance between strong company leadership and appropriate safeguards and oversight by independent directors.

sentences.text: Responsibilities of the Independent Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the responsibilities of the independent Lead Director include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing leadership to ensure the Board works in an independent, cohesive fashion, which includes evaluating the CEOs and Boards performance on an ongoing and annual basis;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as a liaison with TSYS shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: developing the agenda for Board meetings with the Chairman of the Board, Board and Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: having the authority to call meetings of the independent and non-management directors, as needed;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensuring Board leadership in times of crisis;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: developing the agenda for and chairing executive sessions of the independent directors and executive sessions of the non-management directors and acting as liaison between the independent directors and the Chairman of the Board on matters raised in such sessions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: chairing Board meetings when the Chairman of the Board is not in attendance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: working with the Chairman of the Board regarding meeting schedules to ensure the conduct of the Board meeting provides adequate time for serious discussion of appropriate issues and that appropriate information is made available to Board members on a timely basis;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attending meetings of the committees of the Board, as necessary or at his/her discretion, and communicating regularly with the Chairs of the principal standing committees of the Board; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: being available, upon request, for consultation and direct communication with major shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings of Non-Management Directors and Rationale for Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that non-management directors will meet in executive session at least four times a year and that our independent directors will meet in executive session at least once a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, our Lead Director chairs these executive sessions which allow the Board to review key decisions and to discuss matters in a manner that is independent of the Chief Executive Officer, and where necessary, critical of the Chief Executive Officer and senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the leadership of both the Board and TSYS by Mr. Woods is in the best interests of TSYS and its shareholders as it enhances communication between the Board and management and allows Mr. Woods to more effectively execute TSYS business plans and confront its challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the appointment of a strong independent Lead Director and the use of regular executive sessions of the non-management directors, along with the Boards strong committee system and substantial majority of independent directors, allow it to maintain effective oversight of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has overall responsibility for risk oversight with a focus on the most significant risks facing TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A fundamental part of risk oversight is not only understanding the material risks the company faces and the steps management is taking to manage those risks, but also understanding what level of risk is appropriate for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The involvement of the Board of Directors in reviewing TSYS business strategy is an integral aspect of the Boards assessment of managements tolerance for risk and also its determination of what constitutes an appropriate level of risk for TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes that it is neither possible nor prudent to eliminate all risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fact, thoughtful and appropriate risk-taking is essential for TSYS to remain competitive and to achieve its long-term strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight of Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board oversees risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees, which meet regularly and report back to the full Board, play significant roles in carrying out the risk oversight function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS management is charged with managing risk, through robust internal processes and effective internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board exercises its oversight responsibility for risk both directly and through the Audit, Compensation, Corporate Governance and Nominating and Technology Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management of TSYS, which is responsible for day-to-day risk management, maintains an enterprise risk management process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The enterprise risk management process is designed to identify and assess TSYS risks, and to develop steps to mitigate and manage risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On at least an annual basis, our Chief Risk, Compliance and Privacy Officer presents a report to the full Board and the Board discusses the most significant risks that TSYS is facing and the steps management has taken or will take to mitigate those risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the full Board is kept informed of each committees risk oversight and related activities through regular reports from the committee chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has primary responsibility for overseeing TSYS enterprise risk management framework and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee regularly discusses our major financial risk exposures, financial reporting, internal controls, key operational risks, market risks and compliance, and the enterprise risk management framework and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS executive management engages with and/or reports to the Committee on a regular basis to address high priority risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Technology Committee assists the Board and the Audit Committee in the oversight of TSYS management of risks regarding technology, information security, disaster recovery and business continuity, including, but not limited to, risks in these four areas related to hardware, software, personnel, architecture, organizational structure, management, resource allocation, innovation, and research and development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee oversees and reviews managements assessment and management of these technology risks and regularly discusses with management TSYS risk appetite and strategy relating to these risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee oversees risks related to our overall corporate governance structure and processes, including board and committee composition, board size and structure, independence and risks arising from related party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees the risks associated with management resources, succession planning and management development and our compensation structure and programs, including evaluating and assessing risks arising from our compensation policies and practices for all employees, as discussed further below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management recently conducted a risk assessment to evaluate the risks associated with TSYS compensation practices, policies and programs for all employees, including the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managements analysis was reviewed with the Compensation Committee at its February 2017 meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and assessment, we do not believe our compensation programs encourage excessive or inappropriate risk-taking that is reasonably likely to result in a material adverse effect on TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that building positive relationships with our shareholders is critical to TSYS long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value the views of our shareholders and we have both face-to-face meetings and conference calls with them during the year on subjects such as capital allocation, our performance, the regulatory environment, corporate governance and executive compensation in an effort to ensure that management and the Board understand and consider the issues that matter most to our shareholders and to enable TSYS to attempt to address them effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committee Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, our Board and committees conduct self-evaluations to assess the qualifications, attributes, skills and experience represented on the Board; to assess their effectiveness and adherence to our Corporate Governance Guidelines and committee charters; and to identify opportunities to improve Board and committee performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communicating with the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board provides a process for shareholders and other interested parties to communicate with one or more members of the Board, including the independent Lead Director, or the non-management directors individually or as a group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders and other interested parties may communicate with the Board by writing the Board of Directors, Total System Services, Inc., c/o General Counsels Office, One TSYS Way, Columbus, Georgia 31901 or by calling (888) 467-2881.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These procedures are also available in the Corporate Governance section of our website at www.tsys.com, under Investor Relations then Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process for handling shareholder and other communications to the Board has been approved by TSYS independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Composition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating Process and Director Recruitment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee reviews potential director candidates and recommends nominees to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee assesses the size and composition of the Board each year and seeks input from each director with respect to the current composition of the Board in light of TSYS current and future business strategies as a means to identify any backgrounds or skill sets that may be helpful in maintaining or improving alignment between Board composition and our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing Board composition and selecting and recruiting director candidates, the Committee believes it is important to have a mix of experienced directors with a deep understanding of TSYS and others who bring a fresh perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, the Committee recruited two new directors in 2014 and one new director in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is aware that a long-tenured board and/or long-tenured directors may be believed by some to contribute to a lack of diversity and fresh perspectives, and may also diminish a directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee appreciates these concerns and has been focused on director refreshment and succession planning for several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines contain Board membership criteria considered by the Committee in recommending nominees for a position on TSYS Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that, at a minimum, a director candidate must possess the personal qualities of personal and professional integrity, sound judgment and forthrightness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director candidate must also have sufficient time and energy to devote to the affairs of TSYS, be free from conflicts of interest with TSYS, and be willing to make, and financially capable of making, the required investment in TSYS stock pursuant to our Director Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers, among other things, the following criteria when reviewing a director candidate and existing directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The extent of the directors/potential directors business, educational, governmental, non-profit or professional acumen and experience;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the director/potential director assists in achieving a mix of Board members that represents a diversity of background, perspective and experience, including with respect to age, gender, race, place of residence and specialized experience;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the director/potential director meets the independence requirements of the listing standards of the NYSE and our independence guidelines (where independence is desired);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the director/potential director has the financial acumen or other professional or business experience relevant to an understanding of TSYS business; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the director/potential director, by virtue of particular technical expertise, experience or specialized skill relevant to TSYS current or future business, will add specific value as a Board member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines, no person 75 years or older is eligible for election as a member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not assign specific weights to particular criteria and no particular criterion is necessarily applicable to all prospective nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the criteria set forth above, the Committee considers how the skills and attributes of each individual candidate or incumbent director work together to create a board that is collegial, engaged and effective in performing its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board does not have a formal policy on diversity, the Board and the Committee believe that the background and qualifications of the directors, considered as a group, should provide a significant mix of experience, knowledge and abilities that will contribute to Board diversity and allow the Board to effectively fulfill its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee actively considers diversity in recruitment and nominations of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, two of the three most recent additions to the Board are female.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying and Evaluating Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has two primary methods for identifying director candidates (other than those proposed by TSYS shareholders, as discussed below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, the Committee solicits ideas for possible candidates from a number of sources including members of the Board, TSYS executives and individuals personally known to the members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, the Committee may use its authority under its charter to retain at TSYS expense one or more search firms to identify candidates (and to approve such firms fees and other retention terms).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    9
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will consider all director candidates identified through the processes described above and will evaluate each of them, including incumbents, based on the same criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates are evaluated at regular or special meetings of the Committee and may be considered at any point during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If based on the Committees initial evaluation a director candidate continues to be of interest to the Committee, the Chair of the Committee and other Committee members will nterview the candidate and communicate the evaluation to executive management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional interviews are conducted, if necessary, and ultimately the Committee will meet to finalize its list of recommended candidates for the Boards consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will also consider candidates for nomination as a director submitted by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Committee does not have a separate policy that addresses the consideration of director candidates recommended by shareholders, the Board does not believe that such a separate policy is necessary as our bylaws permit shareholders to nominate candidates and as one of the duties set forth in the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee charter is to review and consider director candidates submitted by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees evaluation process does not vary based upon whether a candidate is recommended by a shareholder; provided, however, the procedural requirements set forth in our bylaws and the procedures described under Shareholder Proposals and Nominations on page 59 must be met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Related Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Party Transaction Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a written policy for the review, approval or ratification of certain transactions with related parties of TSYS, which policy is administered by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions that are covered under the policy include any transaction, arrangement or relationship, or series of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships, in which: (1) the aggregate amount involved will or may be expected to exceed $120,000 in any calendar year; (2) TSYS is a participant; and (3) any related party of TSYS (such as an executive officer, director, nominee for election as a director or greater than 5% beneficial owner of TSYS stock, or their immediate family members) has or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to approve or ratify a related party transaction, the Committee must consider, in addition to other factors it deems appropriate, whether the transaction is on terms no less favorable to TSYS than terms generally available to an unaffiliated third party under the same or similar circumstances and the extent of the related partys interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy does not apply to transactions which occurred, or in the case of ongoing transactions, transactions which began, prior to the date of the adoption of the policy by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An entity of which Mr. Cloninger serves as an executive officer made payments to and received payments from TSYS for merchant processing and printing and related services, respectively, in the ordinary course of business during 2016, which payments were significantly less than the greater of two percent of the annual revenues for that entity or TSYS, or $1 million, and therefore satisfy the Boards guidelines for independence.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee is responsible for reviewing and recommending to the Board compensation programs for non-employee directors, which review is conducted annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS does not pay directors who are employees for Board service in addition to their regular employee compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its review of director compensation, the Committee periodically engages an outside consultant to report on director compensation practices and levels, but did not do so in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, from time to time, the Chief Executive Officer may make recommendations to the Committee about types and amounts of appropriate compensation for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no changes to director compensation for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program for non-employee directors is designed to achieve the following goals: compensation should fairly pay directors for work required for a company of TSYS size; compensation should align directors interests with the long-term interests of shareholders; and the structure of the compensation should be simple, transparent and easy for shareholders to understand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual cash retainer for non-employee directors is $75,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee and Technology Committee members receive an additional cash retainer of $10,000, Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee members receive an additional cash retainer of $7,500 and Audit Committee members receive an additional cash retainer of $15,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Chairperson of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee receives a $7,500 cash retainer, the Chairpersons of the Compensation and Technology Committees receive a $10,000 cash retainer, the Chairperson of the Audit Committee receives a $15,000 cash retainer and the Lead Director receives a $20,000 cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, directors may from time to time receive compensation for serving on special committees of the TSYS Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are not compensated for serving on the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferral Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors may elect to defer all or a portion of their cash compensation under the Directors Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors Deferred Compensation Plan does not provide directors with an above market rate of return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the deferred amounts are deposited into one or more investment funds at the election of the director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In so doing, the plan is designed to allow directors to defer the income taxation of a portion of their compensation and to receive an investment return on those deferred amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All deferred fees are payable only in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Driver deferred cash compensation under this plan during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors receive an annual equity award with a fixed value of $130,000, with 50% awarded in the form of fully vested stock options and 50% in the form of fully vested shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are designed to create equity ownership and to focus directors on the long-term performance of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity awards to non-employee directors assist and facilitate directors fulfillment of their stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS Corporate Governance Guidelines require all directors to accumulate over time shares of TSYS stock equal in value to at least three times the value of their annual retainer for Board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have five years to attain this level of total stock ownership but must attain a share ownership threshold of one times the amount of the directors annual retainer within hree years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stock ownership guidelines are designed to align the interests of TSYS directors to that of TSYS shareholders and the long-term performance of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors currently comply with our ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is pleased to present the 11 nominees listed on pages 14 through 18 of this Proxy Statement for election as directors at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the 11 nominees are currently serving on our Board and were elected by shareholders at the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James H. Blanchard and James D. Yancey, current members of our Board, will not be standing for re-election at the Annual Meeting due to having reached mandatory retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We thank Mr. Blanchard and Mr. Yancey for their outstanding service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors determine the size of the Board and for purposes of the Annual Meeting, the number is fixed at 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees for Election as Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All nominees for director have been nominated by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee and approved by the Board for election as directors and, if elected, will hold office until the 2018 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that each director nominee will be able to stand for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee becomes unable to stand for election, proxies in favor of that nominee will be voted in favor of any substitute nominee named by the Board upon the recommendation of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not wish your shares voted for one or more of the nominees, you may so indicate on the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 11 nominees for director were selected by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee based upon a review of the nominees and consideration of the director qualifications described under Director Qualifications on page 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluates each individual in the context of the Board as a whole with the objective of recommending a group of directors that can best perpetuate the success of TSYS business and represent the long-term interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that each director nominee possesses the personal qualities of personal and professional integrity, sound judgment and forthrightness; has sufficient time to dedicate to the affairs of TSYS; is free from conflicts of interest with TSYS; is able to work in a collegial manner; and is in compliance with the requirements of the Director Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also assessed the qualifications, attributes, skills and experience of each director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To follow is certain information with respect to each director nominee, including information with respect to the specific qualifications, attributes, skills and experience that contributed to his or her selection as a member of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2: RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm retained to audit our financial statements and our internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has appointed the firm of KPMG LLP as the independent auditor for TSYS for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG has served as our ndependent auditor since 1983.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules and KPMGs policies, a new Lead Engagement Partner is designated at least every five years to provide a fresh perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A new Lead Engagement Partner was designated for 2014 n consultation with the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews KPMGs independence and performance in deciding whether to retain KPMG or engage another firm as our independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the course of these reviews, the Committee considers, among other things, the quality and efficiency of the services provided by the independent auditor and KPMGs historical and recent performance on the TSYS audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and discussions with senior management, the Committee believes that retaining KPMG is in the best interests of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of KPMG will be present at the Annual Meeting with the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so and will be available to respond to appropriate questions from shareholders present at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although shareholder ratification of the appointment of TSYS independent auditor is not required by our bylaws or otherwise, we are submitting the selection of KPMG to our shareholders for ratification as a matter of good corporate practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If not ratified, the Audit Committee will reconsider the selection, although the Audit Committee will not be required to select a different independent auditor for TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Recommends That You Vote FOR the Ratification of the Appointment of KPMG LLP as the Independent Auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit and Non-Audit Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table presents fees for professional audit services rendered by KPMG LLP for the audit of TSYS annual financial statements for the years ended December 31, 2016 and December 31, 2015 and fees billed for other services rendered by KPMG during those periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Audit fees represent fees for professional services provided in connection with the audit of TSYS financial statements and internal control over financial reporting, reviews of quarterly financial information and audit services provided in connection with other statutory or regulatory filings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Audit related fees consisted principally of certain agreed upon procedures engagements, employee benefit plan audits and assurance related services associated with data center reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Tax fees consisted of fees for tax compliance/preparation and tax consultation services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy on Audit Committee Pre-Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has established a policy to pre-approve all audit and permissible non-audit services provided by the independent auditor in order to assure that the provision of these services does not impair the independent auditors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has considered whether the provision of the non-audit services set forth in the table under Audit and Non-Audit Fees above is compatible with maintaining KPMGs independence and has concluded that it is.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS Audit Committee Pre-Approval Policy addresses services included within the four categories of audit and permissible non-audit services, which include Audit Services, Audit Related Services, Tax Services and All Other Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual audit services engagement terms and fees are subject to the specific pre-approval of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee must specifically pre-approve permissible non-audit services classified as All Other Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    19
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to engagement, management submits to the Committee for approval a detailed list of the Audit Services, Audit Related Services and Tax Services that it recommends the Committee engage the independent auditor to provide for the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each specified service is allocated to the appropriate category and accompanied by a budget estimating the cost of that service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will, if appropriate, approve both the list of Audit Services, Audit Related Services and Tax Services and the budget for such services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is informed at each Committee meeting as to the services actually provided by the independent auditor pursuant to the Pre-Approval Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proposed service that is not separately listed in the Pre-Approval Policy or any service exceeding the pre-approved fee levels must be specifically pre-approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has delegated pre-approval authority to the Chair of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair must report any pre-approval decisions made by her to the Committee at its next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors is comprised of three directors, each of whom the Board has determined to be an independent director as defined by the listing standards of the NYSE and the rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The duties of the Audit Committee are summarized in this Proxy Statement under Committees of the Board on page 4 and are more fully described in the Audit Committee charter adopted by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the Audit Committees primary responsibilities is to assist the Board in its oversight responsibility regarding the integrity of TSYS financial statements and systems of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for TSYS accounting and financial reporting processes, the establishment and effectiveness of internal controls and the preparation and integrity of TSYS consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG LLP, TSYS independent auditor, is responsible for performing an independent audit of TSYS consolidated financial statements and of the effectiveness of TSYS internal control over financial reporting in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) and issuing opinions on whether those financial statements are presented fairly in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and on the effectiveness of TSYS internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation and oversight of KPMG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The function of the Audit Committee is not to duplicate the activities of management or the independent auditor, but to monitor and oversee TSYS financial reporting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In discharging its responsibilities regarding the financial reporting process, the Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed and discussed with management and KPMG TSYS audited financial statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with KPMG the matters required to be discussed by Auditing Standard No. 1301 (Communications with Audit Committees) as adopted by the PCAOB; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received from KPMG the written disclosures and the letter required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding KPMGs communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence and has discussed with KPMG its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the review and discussions referred to in the preceding paragraph, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements referred to above be included in TSYS Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis which follows explains TSYS executive compensation program applicable to the following named executive officers whose 2016 compensation information is provided in the series of tables following this discussion:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: M. Troy Woods, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paul M. Todd, Senior Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pamela A. Joseph, President and Chief Operating Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William A. Pruett, Senior Executive Vice President;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: G. Sanders Griffith, III, Senior Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Patricia A. Watson, Senior Executive Vice President and Chief Information Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have voluntarily disclosed the compensation amounts earned by or paid to Mr. Griffith for 2014 and Ms. Watson for 2016 even though Mr. Griffith was not a named executive officer for 2014 and Ms. Watson was not a named executive officer for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As certain executives are paid similar base salaries, it is possible that TSYS named executive officers could change from year-to-year as both the short-term and long-term incentive awards are expressed as a percentage of base pay and the target percentage for these executives is the same, or similar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this information provides our shareholders with consistent disclosure from year-to-year.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS executive compensation programs align the interests of TSYS executives with those of our shareholders by tying a significant portion of their total compensation directly to our short-term and long-term business results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee (the Committee) reviews the program components, targets and payouts on an annual basis to ensure our pay-for-performance alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive performance is evaluated against both short- and long-term goals with targets and metrics that are directly linked to our annual operational and long-term strategic goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the design of our executive compensation program provides a clear link to shareholder value by focusing our executives on achieving key financial and strategic business objectives and rewarding them when those objectives are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote and Shareholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, we asked shareholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named executive officers as disclosed in the proxy statement for that meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders responded favorably with over 94% of the votes cast in favor of approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Committee appreciate and value the views of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering the results of this advisory vote on executive compensation, the Committee concluded that the compensation paid to our named executive officers and our overall pay practices enjoy strong shareholder support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the strong shareholder support of the compensation paid to our executive officers evidenced by the results of this advisory vote, the Board and the Committee did not make any material changes to our executive compensation program for 2017 as a result of the 2016 say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future advisory votes on executive compensation will serve as an additional tool to guide the Board and the Committee in evaluating the alignment of our executive compensation program with the interests of TSYS and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Committee intend to continue our annual shareholder outreach program pursuant to which we discuss, or offer to discuss, with all shareholders holding 1% or more of TSYS shares their views on general governance issues as well as compensation related matters or any concerns they may have concerning TSYS practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS delivered strong financial and business performance in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total revenues were $4.2 billion, an increase of 50% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues before reimbursable items were $3.9 billion, an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increase of 56.5% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 24    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Basic earnings per share (EPS) were $1.74, a decrease of 11.6% from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS from continuing operations was $2.81, an increase of 14.5% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, we completed the acquisition of TransFirst which was the largest acquisition in our history and it doubled the size of our merchant business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of authorizations and transactions processed during the traditional holiday shopping season were the highest in our history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we used three performance metrics at the enterprise level for our executive compensation program: adjusted EPS from continuing operations, revenues before reimbursable items and relative total shareholder return which is our performance compared to the companies in the S&P 500 (Relative TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Performance Metrics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Adjusted EPS and revenues before reimbursable items are non-GAAP financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS is adjusted earnings divided by weighted average shares outstanding used for basic EPS calculations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted earnings is net income excluding the after-tax impact of stock- based compensation expenses, amortization of acquisition intangibles, litigation, claims, judgments or settlements and TransFirst merger and acquisition expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues before reimbursable items is total revenues less reimbursable items, or pass-through items, such as postage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a reconciliation of these non-GAAP financial measures to the nearest comparable GAAP measure, see Non-GAAP Financial Measures on page 28 of our consolidated financial statements included in our 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders accompanying this Proxy Statement and available on our web site at http://annualreport.tsys.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR is cumulative stock price appreciation plus reinvestment of all dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Components and Linking Pay with Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary components of our named executive officers total compensation are base salary, annual cash incentive awards hrough the Annual Incentive Program (AIP), annual equity-based awards through our Long-Term Incentive Program (LTIP) and retirement and other employee benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our AIP provides cash awards based on our performance against pre-established short-term performance goals aligned with our annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance goals at the enterprise level for the 2016 AIP are based on revenue growth and adjusted EPS growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTIP component of our executives compensation is delivered in two forms of equity grants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: - 40% is in the form of stock options, which align a significant portion of pay to value created for our shareholders through increases in our stock price; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: - 60% is in the form of multi-year performance shares, which link an element of pay to achievement of three-year goals established for key performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance goals for the 2016 LTIP are based on adjusted EPS growth and Relative TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are focused on creating long-term value for our shareholders, and although our TSR for 2016 was slightly negative at (.74%), our TSR for the three-year period from 2014 through 2016 was 51%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is weighted considerably toward long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice creates a substantial retention incentive, encourages our executive officers to focus on TSYS long-term success and aligns with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers our annual operating plan and long-term strategic goals when establishing our AIP and LTIP performance measures and goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    25
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Committee Actions and Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for the named executive officers were increased approximately 3% taking into consideration the performance of each executive and their pay relative to our peer group, with the exception of Mr. Todd who received a base salary increase of approximately 8.5%, Ms. Watson as she was hired in September 2015 and Ms. Joseph as she was hired in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Woods LTIP target award opportunity was increased from 400% of base salary to 450% of base salary taking into consideration his target total compensation positioning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our performance against the 2016 AIP performance goals for growth in revenues before reimbursable items and adjusted EPS at the enterprise level, AIP incentive awards were earned at 164.75% of the target award opportunity at the enterprise level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Pruetts AIP incentive award opportunity also depends on the performance of our North America Services business segment and attainment of personal objectives as is more fully described in the following pages of this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our performance against the LTIP performance goals of compound growth in revenues before reimbursable items and adjusted EPS for the 2014-2016 performance period, performance shares were paid in TSYS shares at 200% of the target award opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The graphs below show the approximate percentage of the CEOs and the other named executive officers 2016 target total direct compensation that is performance-based compensation and nonperformance-based compensation, as approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the graphs below, performance-based compensation is comprised of AIP incentive awards, stock options and performance shares.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the value of performance-based compensation at target by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices embody good corporate governance and reflect best practices within executive compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasis on Performance-based Compensation:    A significant percentage, 85% for our CEO, of the target total direc compensation awarded to our executive officers is in the form of performance-based compensation that is tied to the achievement of performance goals or increase in share value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy:    TSYS may recover incentive compensation paid or awarded to executive officers in certai circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Change of Control Provisions:    Our change of control agreements and equity award agreements require both a change of control of TSYS and actual or constructive termination of employment before change in control benefits are triggered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our equity award agreements subsequent to 2011 provide for pro rata vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 26    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines:    Our executives must hold a significant amount of TSYS stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and other executive officers exceed our guidelines by more than 281%, except Mr. Todd, Ms. Watson and Ms. Joseph who became executive officers in 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Consultant:    The Committee selects and directly engages its own executive compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee must pre-approve the engagement by management of this executive compensation consultant for any other purpose, subject to a de minimis exception.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross-Up Policy:    Agreements adopted or materially amended after December 2011 will not provide for tax gross-up payments to executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a change of control had taken place on December 31, 2016, only one executive officer would have received a tax gross-up payment if his employment was terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Backdating or Repricing of Stock Options:    Stock options are never backdated or issued with below-market exercise prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are never re-priced without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging Policy and Restrictions on Pledging:    Our executive officers and directors may not engage in hedging transactions designed to off-set decreases in the market value of TSYS stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pledging policy, implemented in January 2014, prohibits any future pledging of TSYS shares by directors and executive officers except in situations, and on conditions, pre-approved by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Employment Agreements:    None of our executive officers has an employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Discretionary Bonuses:    The Committee does not authorize discretionary bonuses except in exceptional circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information with respect to the items listed above can be found in the following pages of this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
