sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS executive compensation program aligns to shareholder value and attracts, motivates and retains an exceptionally talented executive team with the skills and vision required for us to become the leading global payment solutions provider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We structure our program to accomplish our key objectives by focusing on our core principles and aligning executive pay with TSYS performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program reflects these core principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: align managements interests with the long-term interests of shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide compensation on the basis of performance that supports key financial and strategic business outcomes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attract, motivate and retain top talent to lead our businesses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reinforce a culture of integrity through our corporate governance initiatives to support sustainable business growth
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assess and appropriately manage compensation risk in the context of our business strategies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: limit perquisites to those that are reasonable and appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our 2016 executive compensation program successfully implements these principles and incorporates best practices in executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Make Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible to our Board for overseeing the development and administration of our compensation policies and program for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, which consists of three independent directors, is responsible for the review and approval of all aspects of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among its duties, the Committee is responsible fo establishing the compensation recommendations for our CEO and reviewing and approving all compensation recommendations for our executive officers, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and approval of corporate incentive goals and objectives relevant to compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluation of the competitiveness of each executive officers total compensation package; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of any changes to the total compensation package, including, but not limited to, base salary, annual and long- term incentive award opportunities and payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is supported in its work by the Chief Human Resource Officer, his staff and an independent executive compensation consultant, as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees charter, which sets out its duties and responsibilities and addresses other matters, can be found on our website at www.tsys.com, under Investor Relations then Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO does not participate in the Committees deliberations or decisions with regard to his compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, within the framework of the compensation programs approved by the Committee and based on managements review of market competitive positions, each year our CEO provides input to the Committee regarding the performance and appropriate compensation of the other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These recommendations are based upon his assessment of each executive officers performance, the performance of the individuals respective business or function and employee retention considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews our CEOs recommendations and approves any compensation changes affecting our executive officers as it determines in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is authorized to retain and terminate any consultant, as well as approve the consultants fees and other terms of retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee directly engaged Meridian Compensation Partners LLC (Meridian) in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 28    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 to advise on executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees consultant provides general observations and market analysis on TSYS compensation programs, but it does not determine or recommend the amount or form of compensation for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following is a description of the consultants duties:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and makes recommendations on the benchmarking peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides executive compensation market benchmark information;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides an equity usage analysis compared to the peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides executive tally sheets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attends meetings of the Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides information, research and analysis pertaining to executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: updates the Committee on market trends, changing practices and regulatory matters pertaining to executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews TSYS executive compensation strategy and program to ensure appropriateness and market-competitiveness
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee recognizes the benefit of receiving objective advice from its executive compensation consultant and has implemented a pre-approval policy that requires the approval of the Committee before TSYS management can engage the executive compensation consultant for the Committee to provide additional services, other than the purchase of national and international compensation surveys for fees that do not exceed $25,000 in any fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Meridian did not provide any services to TSYS other than its advice to the Committee on executive compensation issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered the independence of Meridian in light of SEC rules and NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee requested and received a letter from Meridian addressing its independence, including the following factors: (1) other services provided to us by the consultant; (2) fees paid by us as a percentage of the consulting firms total revenue; (3) policies or procedures maintained by the consulting firm that are designed to prevent a conflict of interest; (4) any business or personal relationships between the individual consultants involved in the engagement and a member of the Committee; (5) any company stock owned by the individual consultants involved in the engagement; and (6) any business or personal relationships between our executive officers and the consulting firm or the individual consultants involved in the engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered these factors and determined that no conflict of interest exists that would prevent Meridian from serving as an independent consultant to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Peer Companies and Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses publicly reported information from companies that we consider as peers when reviewing the compensation of the named executive officers and evaluating performance-based compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is often referred to as benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that benchmarking should be a point of reference for measurement, not determinative of the named executive officers compensation or the performance-based plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Benchmarking Group was selected after considering companies that compete with TSYS for executive talent within similar industries and with similar financial attributes and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer companies used by proxy advisors were also considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Benchmarking Group is reviewed annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the median revenue size of the peer companies was $3.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of ongoing efforts to ensure that appropriate companies are included in the Benchmarking Group, the Committee reviewed the Benchmarking Group for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No changes were initially made to the Benchmarking Group for 2016 but Heartland Payment Systems, Inc. was later removed following its acquisition by Global Payments Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS uses our Benchmarking Group for benchmarking target total direct compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS uses data derived from the Benchmarking Group to benchmark our executive officers base salaries, short-term ncentive awards, long-term incentive awards and target total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the market median when setting total compensation, but it does not target a specific market position and uses comparative market data at the 25th, 50th and 75th percentiles only as reference points to guide its decision making of the type and amount of compensation based on its own evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews tally sheets for the named executive officers annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally sheets present the dollar amount of each element of the named executive officers compensation package, including base salary, AIP incentive awards, current LTIP target award, perquisites, health and welfare benefits, contributions to the qualified Retirement Savings Plan and the non-qualified Deferred Compensation Plan and outstanding equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally sheets also provide estimates of the amounts payable to each executive upon the occurrence of potential future events, such as a change of control, retirement, death, disability, involuntary termination for cause and voluntary or involuntary termination without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally sheets provide a summary of all elements of an executives compensation package, as well as information on wealth accumulation, so that the Committee can analyze both the individual elements of compensation (including the compensation mix) and the aggregate total amount of actual and projected compensation to determine whether the executives compensation is reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elements of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary elements of compensation in TSYS executive compensation program are discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Base Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base pay provides our executives with a level of compensation commensurate with their respective skills, responsibilities, experience and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the amount paid to an executive for effectively performing his or her job on a daily basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure that base pay is competitive, TSYS benchmarks an executives base pay against base pay paid by our Benchmarking Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executives current base pay is compared to market information for that position, with an emphasis on the market median, using proxy statement information from our Benchmarking Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For certain positions for which there is no clear market match in the benchmarking data, the Committee uses a blend of two or more positions from the benchmarking data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After reviewing the benchmarking data, the Committee establishes a competitive base salary for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See The Role of Peer Companies and Benchmarking section on page 29 for a list of the companies in the Benchmarking Group and information on the process used to select these companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to market comparisons of similar positions at our peer companies, individual performance may affect base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comparison of an executives base pay to the base pay of other TSYS executives may also be a factor in establishing base pay, especially with respect to positions for which there is no clear market match in benchmarking data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the process used to establish base pay, large increases generally occur only when an executive is promoted into a new position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base pay is not directly related to TSYS performance, except over the long term, since revenues are used in benchmarking base pay against our Benchmarking Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the named executive officers received increases in base pay of approximately 3% effective January 1, 2016 based on each executive officers performance over the prior year and a review of base salaries among the Benchmarking Group, with the exception of Mr. Todd who received a base salary increase of approximately 8.5%, Ms. Watson as she was hired in September 2015 and Ms. Joseph as she was hired in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Todds base salary was increased 8.5% because of his rapid and effective assimilation into the CFO role and to competitively align his base salary to the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base pay for 2016 is set forth in the Salary column in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table on page 39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive awards through the AIP provide an incentive for our executives to meet short-term performance goals as reflected in our annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, given the prevalence of short-term incentive compensation in the marketplace, AIP incentive awards are necessary to provide a competitive compensation program.

sentences.text: To ensure that the AIP incentive awards are deemed performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (Section 162(m)), for 2016 the Committee established a funding pool for the AIP for the named executive officers.

sentences.text: The Committee also established individual award limits for each named executive officer expressed as a percentage of the funding pool.

sentences.text: The funding pool effectively establishes, for Section 162(m) purposes, the maximum amount that may be paid to any named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee may, in its discretion, adjust downward (but not upward) the amount actually paid to any named executive officer.

sentences.text: The amount of AIP incentive awards actually paid to each named executive officer was determined by the Committee based on achievement of the AIP performance metrics discussed above, and in each case was less than the named executive officers allocable portion of the funding pool.

sentences.text: The Committee believes that stock options are an appropriate equity vehicle for a portion of LTIP compensation because they are performance-based, providing value only if the value of our stock price increases over time, which aligns our executives interests with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are awarded in the performance year and generally vest in three equal annual installments on the anniversaries of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of a stock option is determined as of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that performance shares are an appropriate equity vehicle for the majority of LTIP compensation because performance shares align executives interests with the interests of shareholders by focusing executives on the long- term performance of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year the Committee establishes performance goals for the performance share portion of the annual LTIP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee linked the 2016 performance share portion of the LTIP award to adjusted EPS from continuing operations and Relative TSR during the period 2016-2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executive officers receive an initial target award of performance shares determined as of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the three-year performance period, a named executive officers payout of his or her performance share award will range from zero to 200% of target based on achievement of the pre-established performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Committee may take action to approve LTIP awards on or near the date that TSYS earnings are released, the Committee has established the last business day of the month in which earnings are released as the grant date for equity awards to executive officers to ensure that the earnings release has had time to be absorbed by the market before equity awards are granted and stock option exercise prices are established.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the date of the TSYS earnings release or the date the Committee takes action is within five business days of the last business day of the month, the grant date is postponed for five business days after the later of the TSYS earnings release or the date the Committee takes action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to performance-based equity awards other than conventional stock options, awards vest on the date that the Committee certifies that the required performance goals have been attained.

sentences.text: Qualified Plan and Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS maintains a broad-based qualified retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Retirement Savings Plan, TSYS can make discretionary contributions based on profits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS also matches 401(k) contributions up to 4% of a participants eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, all eligible participants, including each named executive officer, received a matching contribution of 4% of eligible compensation under the Retirement Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions to the Retirement Savings Plan for 2016 are included in the All Other Compensation column in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table on page 39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS also sponsors a nonqualified plan, the TSYS Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS makes contributions to the Deferred Compensation Plan in an amount equal to the benefits that cannot be contributed to the Retirement Savings Plan due to limits imposed by the IRS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, participants in the Deferred Compensation Plan may elect to contribute all or a portion of their base pay and cash bonuses under the AIP to the Deferred Compensation Plan, and TSYS matches the contribution at the same rate applicable under the Retirement Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assets of the Deferred Compensation Plan are held in a rabbi trust, which is subject to claims by TSYS creditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Deferred Compensation Plan does not pay above market interest, contributions to the Deferred Compensation Plan for 2016 are included in the All Other Compensation column in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table on page 39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the Deferred Compensation Plan invest amounts held for their benefit among specified mutual funds that are substantially similar to the mutual funds offered under the Retirement Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoveries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under TSYS clawback policy, the Committee may direct that TSYS recover all or a portion of any incentive award granted or paid to a named executive officer if the incentive award is computed using materially misstated financial information or other performance metric criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount to be recovered is equal to the excess of the incentive award paid or granted over the incentive award that would have been paid or granted had the financial information or performance metric been fairly stated at the time the incentive award was paid or granted, or any greater or lesser amount (up to the entire incentive award) that the Committee determines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To align the interests of our executives and directors with our shareholders, TSYS has stock ownership guidelines for our executives and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are required to own a multiple of their base pay in TSYS stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO is required to own TSYS stock with a value of six times base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our President is required to own TSYS stock valued at four times base pay and the other named executive officers are required to own TSYS stock valued at three times their base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives generally have a five-year grace period to comply with the guidelines, with an interim three- year goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the guidelines are met, executives are required to retain all stock acquired by them through our equity compensation plans, net of taxes and transaction costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a severe financial hardship, the guidelines permit the development of an alternative ownership plan by the Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our executive officers exceeds these guidelines by more than 281%, except Mr. Todd, Ms. Watson and Ms. Joseph, who became executive officers in 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors and executive officers are prohibited from entering into speculative transactions in TSYS stock, including engaging in short sales of TSYS stock, trading in publicly traded options, puts, calls or other derivative securities related to TSYS stock and engaging in hedging transactions involving TSYS stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pledging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pledging policy, which was implemented in January 2014, prohibits any future pledging of TSYS shares by directors and executive officers except in situations, and on conditions, pre-approved by the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee of TSYS.

sentences.text: In addition, the policy provides that shares of TSYS stock that are pledged by directors and executive officers are not included when calculating whether the individual is in compliance with director and executive officer stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross-Up Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our no tax gross-up policy prohibits TSYS from making any tax gross-up payments to executive officers, and is applicable to new agreements and agreements that are materially amended subsequent to December 13, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the change of control agreements for Ms. Joseph and Ms. Watson do not provide for tax gross-up payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in the event a change of control had taken place on December 31, 2016 and the executive officers were terminated the only executive officer that would have received a tax gross-up payment is Mr. Todd.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Termination Compensation Philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS believes that compensation should generally be earned by executives while they are actively employed (i.e., while contributing to TSYS performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although retirement benefits are paid following an executives retirement, the benefits are earned while employed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS has entered into limited post- termination arrangements when appropriate, such as permitting equity to continue to vest in certain circumstances upon retirement as if the executive was still employed and the change of control agreements that are described under Potential Payouts Upon Termination or Change-in-Control on page 43.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS chose to enter into change of control arrangements with its executives to: (1) ensure the retention of executives and an orderly transition during a change of control; (2) ensure that executives would be financially protected in the event of a change of control so they continue to act in the best interests of TSYS while continuing to manage TSYS during a change of control; and (3) ensure a competitive compensation package because such arrangements are common in the market and it was determined that the agreements were important in recruiting and retaining executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Backdating or Repricing of Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are never backdated or issued with below-market exercise prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are never re-priced without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with making decisions on executive compensation, the Committee takes into consideration the provisions of Section 162(m), which limits the deductibility by TSYS for federal income tax purposes of certain categories of compensation in excess of $1 million paid to certain executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is TSYS policy to maximize the effectiveness of our compensation programs while also taking into consideration the requirements of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that regard, the Committee intends to maintain the flexibility to take actions that it deems to be in the best interests of TSYS and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, although the Committee intends to preserve the deductibility of annual compensation to the extent consistent with the intent and spirit of our overall compensation policy, it reserves the authority to exercise its discretion and award non-deductible compensation as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of excise taxes that may be due with respect to change of control agreements with executive officers that were entered into prior to December 13, 2011, TSYS does not gross-up its named executive officers for taxes that are due with respect to their compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS executive compensation program provides payment opportunities related to different time periods (i.e., short and long-term components); however, TSYS does not offer incentives that promote short-term objectives at the expense of long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elements of compensation include current cash payments, deferred cash and equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts are based on a combination of financial metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts paid to executives under our program are reasonable compared to market, and the Committee retains significant discretion to limit performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the risks inherent in our executive compensation program, and the Committee has determined that our program is balanced and does not encourage executives to take unnecessary and excessive risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting Considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We account for all compensation paid in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accounting treatment has generally not affected the form of compensation paid to the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first event is a change of control and the second event is the actual or constructive termination of the executive within two years following the date of the change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change of control is defined, in general, as the acquisition of 20% of TSYS stock for Mr. Woods, Mr. Todd, Mr. Pruett and Mr. Griffith, and 30% for Ms. Joseph and Ms. Watson, by any person as defined under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, turnover of more than one-third of the Board of Directors of TSYS, a merger of TSYS with another company, or a reorganization, sale or similar transaction, unless the former shareholders of TSYS own more than 60% of the surviving entity for Mr. Woods, Mr. Todd, Mr. Pruett and Mr. Griffith, and 50% for Ms. Joseph and Ms. Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of these agreements, a constructive termination is a voluntary termination for good reason when there is a material adverse reduction in an executives position, duties or responsibilities, relocation of the executive more than 35 miles from where the executive is employed, or a material reduction in the executives base salary, bonus or other employee benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event payments are triggered under the agreements, each executive will receive three times his or her base salary as in effect prior to the termination, three times a percentage of his or her base salary equal to the average short-term incentive award percentage earned over the previous three calendar years prior to the termination, as well as a pro rata short-term incentive award calculated at target for the year of termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts will be paid to the executive in a single lump-sum cash payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive will also receive health and welfare benefits for a three-year period following the second triggering event, or the equivalent value thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each executive except Ms. Joseph and Ms. Watson will receive an amount that is designed to gross-up the executive for any excise taxes that are payable by the executive as a result of the payments under the agreement, but only if the total change of control payments to the executive exceed 110% of the applicable IRS cap.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has adopted a policy pursuant to which it will no longer make tax gross-up payments to executive officers, which policy is applicable to new agreements and agreements that are materially amended, and as such Ms. Josephs and Ms. Watsons change of control agreements do not contain a gross-up provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our equity award agreements with named executive officers require actual or constructive termination of employment in addition to a change of control before acceleration of vesting is triggered and beginning in 2012 all award agreements provide for vesting on a pro rata basis.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3: APPROVAL, ON AN ADVISORY BASIS, OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation paid to our named executive officers as described in the Executive Compensation section found on pages 24 to 44 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement, the Compensation Committee has structured our executive compensation program to achieve the following key objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objective    How Our Executive Compensation Program Achieves This Objective Pay for Performance       Tying a significant portion of each named executive officers targeted total direct compensation to the achievement of performance goals Alignment with Shareholder Interests       Establishing performance metrics under our LTIP and AIP that are designed to focus executives on the strategic objectives of TSYS Commitment to Compensation Best Practices       Minimal executive perquisites    Clawback policy for incentive compensation awards    Stock ownership requirements    No tax gross-up policy for new agreements Attract and Retain Top Talent       Competing effectively for the highest quality people who will determine our long-term success
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge shareholders to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 24 of this Proxy Statement, which describes in more detail how our executive compensation policies and procedures operate and are designed to achieve our compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board believe that our compensation policies and procedures are effective in achieving our goals and that the compensation of our named executive officers reported in this Proxy Statement has contributed to TSYS long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareholders to approve the following advisory resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders of TSYS approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of TSYS named executive officers disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Summary Compensation Table and the related compensation tables, notes and narrative in this Proxy Statement for TSYS 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory resolution, commonly referred to as a say-on-pay resolution, is non-binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the advisory vote is non-binding, the Board and the Compensation Committee value the opinions of our shareholders, and will continue to review and consider the voting results when making future decisions regarding our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board and the Committee intend to continue our annual shareholder outreach program pursuant to which we discuss, or offer to discuss, with all shareholders holding 1% or more of TSYS shares their views on compensation related matters so that we can also consider them when making future decisions about our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined to hold annual advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the next advisory vote on executive compensation will occur at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, unless the Board modifies its policy on the frequency of holding such advisory votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Recommends That You Vote FOR the Approval of the Advisory Resolution Approving the Compensation of Our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    45
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the advisory approval of our executive compensation program, we are also seeking a non-binding determination from our shareholders as to the frequency with which shareholders will have an opportunity to provide an advisory approval o our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing shareholders with the option of selecting a frequency of one, two or three years, or abstaining.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons described below, we recommend that our shareholders select a frequency of one year, or an annual vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starting with our annual meeting held in 2011, we have held annual advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even though our executive compensation program is designed to support long-term value creation, our Compensation Committee reviews the compensation program every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual advisory vote on executive compensation allows our shareholders to provide us with their direct and immediate input on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy statement every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We therefore request that our shareholders vote for holding future advisory votes on executive compensation every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of one year, two years or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast by shareholders will be the frequency for the advisory vote on executive compensation that has been selected by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board value the opinions expressed by shareholders in these votes and will continue to consider the outcome of these votes in making decisions concerning the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and not binding on our Board or TSYS in any way, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and TSYS to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the option approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Recommends That You Vote For a Frequency of 1 Year With Respect to Holding Future Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5: APPROVAL OF THE TOTAL SYSTEM SERVICES, INC. 2017 OMNIBUS PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking you to approve the Total System Services, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Plan (2017 Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Compensation Committee, on January 24, 2017, the Board of Directors adopted the 2017 Plan, subject to shareholder approval, for the benefit of non-employee directors and eligible employees of TSYS and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder approval of the 2017 Plan is sought:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To permit the issuance of a maximum of 15,000,000 shares of TSYS common stock pursuant to awards granted under the 2017 Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To approve the material terms of performance-based compensation awards subject to Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (Section 162(m)), including the performance measures used by the 2017 Plan, and to thereby allow TSYS to deduct for federal income tax purposes certain compensation paid under the 2017 Plan to certain named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To satisfy the requirements of Section 422(b) of the Internal Revenue Code so that certain options issued under the 2017 Plan may qualify as incentive stock options; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To satisfy the governance requirements of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan will become effective upon shareholder approval, and the 2017 Plan and all awards granted thereunder are conditioned on shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If approved by shareholders, the 2017 Plan will become the successor to the Total System Services, Inc. 2012 Omnibus Plan, as amended (Prior Plan), and no further grants of awards will be made under the Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, outstanding awards granted under the Prior Plan will remain outstanding and shall continue to be administered in accordance with the terms of the Prior Plan and the applicable award agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares remaining available for issuance under the Prior Plan will not be transferred to the 2017 Plans share pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the 2017 Plan is to foster and promote the long-term financial success of TSYS by motivating superior performance by means of performance-related incentives, encouraging and providing for the acquisition of an ownership interest in TSYS by participants, and enabling TSYS to attract and retain qualified and competent employees and members of the Board, whose judgment, interest and performance are required for the successful operations of TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the 2017 Plan will help us attract, retain and reward the best talent and align their interests with shareholders, including retaining key employees at companies that are acquired by TSYS as part of its growth strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan aligns with current best practices, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No discounted stock options or stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requires that stock options and stock appreciation rights have an exercise price of no less than fair market value on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No repricing of stock options or stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Includes an explicit prohibition on re-pricing stock options or stock appreciation rights without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No liberal share counting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan does not include liberal share counting methodologies, such as allowing shares tendered or withheld for taxes to be added back to the shares available for issuance under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Annual Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits the number and type of awards that any one participant may receive during any year, including limits on awards to non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-trigger change in control vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If awards granted under the 2017 Plan are assumed by a successor in connection with a change in control of TSYS, such awards will not automatically vest and pay out solely as a result of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividends on unearned performance awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any dividends declared on awards subject to performance condition will be subject to the same performance conditions and service conditions, as applicable, as the underlying award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under the 2017 Plan will be subject to our existing compensation recoupment policy and any additional policy that we may adopt from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of the 2017 Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a summary of the material terms of the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary is qualified in its entirety by the full text of the 2017 Plan, which is attached to this Proxy Statement as Appendix A. Capitalized terms used in this summary, but not otherwise defined in this summary, shall have the respective meanings ascribed to them in the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration of the 2017 Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan will be administered by the Committee, the members of which are appointed by the Board of Directors from among its members and may be removed by the Board in its discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has broad discretion to construe, interpret and administer the 2017 Plan, to select the individuals to be granted awards, to determine the number of shares subject to each award, and to determine the terms, conditions and duration of each award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the express limitations set forth in the 2017 Plan, the Committee has the full and exclusive discretionary power and authority to take such actions as it deems necessary and advisable with respect to the administration of the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees decisions will be final and binding upon all parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Committee will be liable for any action taken or determination made with respect to the 2017 Plan or any award granted under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, TSYS will indemnify and hold harmless the members of the Committee against and from any loss, cost, liability or expenses incurred in connection with or resulting from any action taken against them with respect to the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility and Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any employee of TSYS and its subsidiaries or affiliates, and any non-employee director of TSYS, is eligible to participate in the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has discretion to select participants from year to year, provided that the Board will approve all awards to non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 11,500 employees and non-employee directors are eligible to participate in the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Available For Issuance Under the 2017 Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares of TSYS common stock available for issuance pursuant to awards under the 2017 Plan is 15,000,000 shares (share pool), subject to adjustment as described in the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares available for issuance under the 2017 Plan may be authorized and unissued shares or treasury shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any of the authorized shares may be used for any type of award under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, no further award grants will be made under the Prior Plan, and the shares remaining available for issuance under the Prior Plan will not be transferred to the 2017 Plans share pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the shareholders do not approve the 2017 Plan at the shareholders meeting, the Prior Plan will continue and grants may continue to be made under the Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, for the purposes of determining the number of shares available in the share pool, the share pool shall be reduced by one share for every one share granted with respect to an award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following shares covered by an award will be added back to the share pool and will be available again for grant under the 2017 Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any shares related to awards which terminate by expiration, forfeiture, cancellation, or otherwise without the issuance of such shares (or with the forfeiture of shares in connection with a restricted stock award);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any shares that are settled in cash in lieu of shares; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any shares that are exchanged with the Committees permission prior to the issuance of shares for awards not involving shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following shares covered by an award will not be added back to the share pool and will not be available again for grant under the 2017 Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any shares that are withheld by TSYS or tendered by a participant to pay the exercise price of awards under the 2017 Pla
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any shares used to satisfy tax withholding obligations associated with an award granted under the 2017 Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any shares purchased on the open market with the proceeds of a stock option exercise; an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to the extent stock appreciation rights are to be settled by the issuance of shares, the full number of shares subject to such award regardless of the number of shares actually issued upon settlement of such stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any award granted upon the assumption of, or in substitution or exchange for, outstanding awards granted by a company or other entity acquired by TSYS (or its subsidiary or affiliate) will not reduce the number of shares in the share pool, nor will such shares be counted for purposes of the maximum individual annual award limits discussed below.

sentences.text: Awards Under the 2017 Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following types of awards may be granted under the 2017 Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified and Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stock option provides the participant with the right to buy a specified number of shares at a specified price (exercise price) after certain conditions have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may grant both nonqualified stock options (NQSOs) and incentive stock options (ISOs) under the 2017 Plan, but ISOs may be granted only to employees of TSYS or its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax treatment of NQSOs is different from the tax treatment of ISOs, as explained in the section below entitled Federal Income Tax Consequences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will determine and specify in the award agreement whether the option is an NQSO or ISO, the number of shares subject to the option, the exercise price of the option and the period of time during which the option may be exercised (including the impact of a termination of employment).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No option can be exercisable more than ten years after the date of grant and the exercise price of a stock option must be at least equal to the fair market value of a share of TSYS common stock on the date of grant of the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to an ISO granted to an employee who holds more than 10% of TSYSs total voting stock, the ISO cannot be exercisable more than five years after the date of grant and the exercise price must be at least equal to 110% of the fair market value of a share of TSYS common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of exercise, payment in full of the exercise price can be paid in cash, by tendering or having TSYS withhold shares of TSYS common stock valued at their fair market value on the date of exercise, by cashless (broker-assisted) exercise, by a combination of the foregoing, or by such other method approved or accepted by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stock appreciation right (SAR) entitles the participant to receive payment for the difference (spread) between the grant price of the SAR and the market value of a share of TSYS common stock at the time of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will determine and specify in the SAR award agreement the number of shares subject to the SAR, the SAR exercise price (which must be at least equal to the fair market value of a share of TSYS common stock on the date of grant of the SAR), the conditions upon which the SAR becomes vested and exercisable, and the period of time during which the SAR may be exercised (including the impact of a termination of employment).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No SAR can be exercisable more than ten years after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may authorize payment of the spread for a SAR in the form of cash, shares of TSYS common stock, or a combination thereof, as provided in the award agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will specify the terms of a restricted stock award or restricted stock unit award (RSU) in the award agreement, including the number of shares of restricted stock or units, the purchase price, if any, to be paid for such restricted stock/unit, any restrictions applicable to the restricted stock/unit such as continued service or achievement of performance goals, and the length of the restriction period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Committee specifies otherwise in the award agreement, RSUs will be settled in shares of TSYS common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant receiving a restricted stock award shall have voting rights to the extent set forth in the award agreement, but a participant receiving an award of RSUs will not have voting rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units or Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance share will have an initial value equal to the fair market value of a share of TSYS common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance unit will have an initial value that is established by the Committee at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will set performance goals which, depending on the extent to which they are met during the performance period, and the satisfaction of applicable service-based vesting conditions, will determine the number or value of the performance shares or performance units that will vest (which number or value may be greater than the target number of performance shares or performance units granted to the participant) and be paid to the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the close of the performance period, or as soon thereafter as practicable, any earned performance shares will be paid in shares of TSYS common stock unless otherwise specified in the award agreement, and any earned performance units will be paid in the form of cash, shares of TSYS common stock, or a combination, as specified in the award agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash-Based Awards and Other Stock-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may grant cash-based awards to participants in such amounts and upon such terms as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each cash-based award will specify a payment amount or range, and may be subject to performance goals as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may grant other types of equity-based or equity-related awards in such amounts and upon such terms as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other stock- based awards will be expressed in terms of shares or units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: based on shares, and may be subject to performance goals as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of cash-based awards and other stock-based awards may be made in cash, shares of TSYS common stock, other forms of awards under the 2017 Plan, or a combination thereof, as determined by the Committee, unless the Committee permits a participant to elect the form of payment in accordance with procedures adopted by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends and Dividend Equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to an award of restricted stock, the Committee may grant or limit the right of a participant to receive dividends on unvested restricted stock, and shall specify whether such dividends are to be paid at the applicable dividend payment dates or at such other dates specified by the Committee, and whether such dividends will be paid in cash or reinvested in additional shares of TSYS common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to awards other than stock options, SARs and restricted stock, the Committee may grant dividend equivalents with respect to the shares or units subject to such award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of such dividend equivalents will be set forth in the award agreement, including the time and form of payment and whether such dividend equivalents will be credited with interest or deemed to be reinvested in additional shares or units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent the award to which the dividends or dividend equivalents relate is subject to one or more performance vesting conditions, such dividends or dividend equivalents will be subject to the same performance and service vesting conditions as are applicable to the underlying award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 162(m), we may not deduct compensation in excess of $1,000,000 paid to a covered employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A covered employee is an employee who is, on the last day of TSYS taxable year in which the deduction would otherwise be claimed, TSYS chief executive officer or one of the other three highest paid officers named in its proxy statement (excluding ts chief financial officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limit does not apply to compensation that satisfies the applicable requirements for the performance-based compensation exception under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One such requirement of Section 162(m) is that shareholders approve the material terms of the compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan is designed to ensure that all stock options and SARs granted to a covered employee will qualify as performance-based compensation and will be exempt from the Section 162(m) limitation on deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may also designate any other award (other than a stock option or SAR) as performance-based compensation that is designed to meet the requirements for deductibility under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an award is intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m), the performance measure or measures to be used for purposes of such awards must be chosen from among the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Assets,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Cash flow (including, but not limited to, operating cash flow, free cash flow, cash flow return on equity, and cash flow return on investment),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Customer satisfaction,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Earnings per share,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Earnings before or after either, or any combination of, interest, taxes, depreciation, or amortization,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) Economic value added (net operating profit after tax minus the sum of capital multiplied by the cost of capital),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) Expenses/costs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) Gross or net earnings or income,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Gross or net operating margins,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) Gross or net operating profits,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) Gross or net sales or revenues,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) Individual objective performance measures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) Market share,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) Net earnings or net income (before or after taxes),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o) Number of cardholder, merchant and/or other customer accounts processed or converted,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p) Operating efficiency,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q) Productivity ratios and measures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (r) Return measures (including, but not limited to, return on assets, total assets employed, equity, capital, invested capital, sales or revenues),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (s) Share price (including, but not limited to, growth in share price and total shareholder return)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (u) Successful negotiation or renewal of contracts with new or existing customers

sentences.text: The Committee will determine the length of the performance period over which performance is to be measured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any performance measure may relate to TSYS, a subsidiary or affiliate as a whole, or to any business unit, division or segment of TSYS, a subsidiary or affiliate, in which the participant is employed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance may also be measured relative to the performance of a group of comparator companies or any published or special index, be based on the change in the applicable performance measure over a specified period, and may relate to one or more performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the completion of the performance period, the Committee will determine whether the applicable performance measures have been met with respect to a particular award and, if they have, certify in writing and ascertain the amount payable under the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether any performance measure has been satisfied, the Committee is authorized to include or exclude the impact, if any, on reported financial results of, among other things, any of the following events that occur during the performance period: asset write downs; litigation, claims, judgments or settlements; changes in tax laws, accounting principles or other laws; reorganization or restructuring programs; acquisitions and divestitures; foreign exchange gains and losses; or gains and losses that are treated as unusual in nature and infrequent in their occurrence and which are disclosed in the managements discussion and analysis of financial condition in TSYS annual report to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such exclusions and adjustments may only apply to the extent the Committee specifies in writing (not later than the time performance measures are required to be established) which exclusions and adjustments the Committee will apply to determine whether a performance measure has been satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may not use discretion to increase the amount payable under any awards intended to qualify as performance- based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may, however, exercise negative discretion to reduce any award as it determines appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards may be granted either alone or in addition to other grants made under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may grant awards under the 2017 Plan that do not qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payment of any non-qualifying awards to a covered employee could be non-deductible by us, in whole or in part, under Section 162(m), depending on the covered employees total compensation in the applicable year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maximum Amount Payable to Any Participant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan includes the following individual annual award limits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options and Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate number of shares with respect to which options or stock appreciation rights may be granted in any calendar year to any one participant is 4,000,000 shares of TSYS common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Performance Shares and Other Stock-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate number of shares that may be subject to awards of restricted stock, restricted stock units, performance shares or other stock-based awards that is performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) and that is granted in any calendar plan year to any one participant, shall be 2,000,000 shares of TSYS common stock or its cash equivalent, determined as of the date of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units, Cash-Based Awards and any Other Award Paid in Cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate amount that may be paid to any participant in any calendar year under an award of performance units, cash-based awards, or other awards paid or denominated in cash, in each case that is performance-based compensation under Section 162(m), shall be $6,000,000 determined as of the date of payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent any such award is settled in shares of TSYS common stock, the $6,000,000 limit will be determined based on the fair market value of the shares to be issued as of the applicable vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Director Limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate value of equity-based awards (determined as of the grant date) that may be granted to any non-employee director in any calendar year shall not exceed $400,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    51

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provided that the limit shall be increased to $600,000 for any non-employee director who serves as the Chairman of the Board or Lead Director, and that the limit shall be increased to $600,000 for the year in which the non-employee director is first appointed or elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may permit a non-employee director the opportunity to receive an award under he 2017 Plan in lieu of all or a portion of his or her future director fees (including but not limited to cash retainer fees and meeting fees), and the foregoing annual award limits do not apply to any shares or share equivalents granted to a non-employee director in lieu of cash-based director fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments in Connection with Certain Events
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of any equity restructuring (within the meaning of FASB ASC Topic 718 or any successor provision) that causes the per share value of a share of TSYS common stock to change (such as a stock dividend, stock split, reverse stock split, split up, spin-off, rights offering or recapitalization through an extraordinary dividend), or in the event of any other change in corporate capitalization (including a merger, consolidation, reorganization, or partial or complete liquidation) to the extent such event does not constitute an equity restructuring or business combination within the meaning of FASB ASC Topic 718 or any successor provision, the Committee, in order to prevent dilution or enlargement of a participants rights under the 2017 Plan, shall substitute or adjust, as applicable, the number and kind of shares or other securities that may be issued under the 2017 Plan or under particular forms of awards, the number and kind of shares or other securities subject to outstanding awards, the option price or grant price applicable to outstanding awards, the annual award limits, and other value determinations applicable to outstanding awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee may, in its discretion, make other adjustments or modifications in the terms of any awards it deems appropriate to reflect any of the foregoing corporate events, including but not limited to the modification of performance goals, changing the length of the performance period and the substitution of property of equivalent value for the shares available under the 2017 Plan or the shares covered by awards, in each case only to the extent permitted by Section 162(m), and in connection with the sale of a subsidiary, arranging for the assumption, or replacement with new awards, of awards held by participants following the sale of such subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Duration of the 2017 Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan will become effective, subject to approval by TSYS shareholders, on April 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan will terminate after 10 years or, if sooner, when all shares reserved under the 2017 Plan have been issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At any time, the Board of Directors may terminate the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The termination of the 2017 Plan will not affect outstanding awards in any way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transferability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards are not transferrable other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution, or subject to the consent of the Committee, pursuant to a domestic relations order.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards shall be subject to attachment, execution, or levy, and any purported transfer shall be null and void.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each option or SAR may be exercisable only by the participant during his or her lifetime.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may establish procedures for a participant to designate a beneficiary to receive payment of awards in the event of the participants death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may, in its discretion, approve the transfer by gift of an award (other than an ISO), subject to such terms and conditions determined by the Committee and subject to securities and other applicable laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment of the 2017 Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may at any time amend, suspend or terminate the 2017 Plan, and the Board or the Committee may at any time amend, suspend or terminate any outstanding award agreement; however, no amendment or termination shall adversely affect in any material way any rights or obligations with respect to an award previously granted without the affected participants written consent, except that the Board may amend the 2017 Plan, and the Board or the Committee may amend an award agreement, for purposes of conforming the 2017 Plan or such award agreement to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) applicable laws and the administrative regulations and rulings promulgated thereunder (including but not limited to Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code (Section 409A),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) applicable stock exchange requirements, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any compensation recoupment policy adopted by TSYS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without shareholder approval, no stock option or SAR may be amended to reduce the exercise price or grant price, or cancelled in exchange for the grant of any new stock option or SAR with a lower exercise price or grant price, or cancelled in exchange for cash, other property or any new award at a time when the exercise price of the stock option or the grant price of the SAR is greater than the market value of a share of TSYS common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as may be limited by the restrictions under Section 162(m), the Committee may make adjustments in the terms and conditions of awards in recognition of unusual or nonrecurring events affecting TSYS or its financial statements, or of changes in applicable laws,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: regulations, or accounting principles, whenever the Committee determines that such adjustments are appropriate in order to prevent unintended dilution or enlargement of the benefits or potential benefits intended to be provided under the 2017 Plan.

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control, unless otherwise provided in the award agreement, with respect to an award which is not assumed and/or replaced by the surviving entity,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any outstanding stock option and SAR will become fully vested (and to the extent applicable, all performance conditions deemed satisfied at target performance) and will be exercisable as set forth in the award agreement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any outstanding award (other than options and SARs) which is subject solely to time-based vesting conditions shall become fully vested and settled in cash, shares or a combination thereof, generally within thirty days following the change in control, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any outstanding award (other than options and SARs) which is subject to performance-based vesting conditions shall be deemed to have satisfied all performance conditions at the target performance level and settled pro rata, based on the proportion of the applicable performance period that lapsed through the date of the change in control, in cash, shares or a combination thereof, generally within thirty days following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control, unless otherwise provided in the award agreement, with respect to an award which is assumed and/or replaced by the surviving entity with a replacement award (as defined below), to the extent the participants employment is involuntarily terminated by TSYS without cause or by the participant for good reason (as defined in the participants award agreement, change in control agreement or employment agreement, as applicable), in either case occurring within two years following the change in control, then any such replacement award which is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a stock option or SAR will become fully vested and exercisable,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a service-based award (other than a stock option or SAR) shall become fully vested and paid generally upon or within sixty days of the participants termination, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a performance-based award will become fully vested and shall be deemed satisfied at the target performance level and paid pro rata (based on the proportion of the applicable performance period that lapsed through the date of the participants termination), generally upon or within sixty days of the participants termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Replacement award means an award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) of the same type (e.g., option, RSU, etc.) as the replaced award (or a different type than the replaced award if the Committee finds such type acceptable),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) that has a value at least equal to the value of the replaced award,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) that relates to publicly traded equity securities of TSYS or its successor following the change in control (or another entity that is affiliated with TSYS or its successor following the change in control), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) that has other terms and conditions of which are not less favorable to the participant than the terms and conditions of the replaced award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise provided in the award agreement, in the event of a change in control, with respect to any stock option or SAR, the Committee may provide a cash payment in lieu of the right to exercise such stock option or SAR, and with respect to any award (other than a stock option or SAR) that would otherwise be payable in shares, the Committee may cause the payment of such award to be made in cash instead of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback and Cancellation Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under the 2017 Plan are subject to any clawback policy adopted by TSYS from time to time, including clawback policies adopted to comply with any law, government regulation or stock exchange listing requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS may also provide for recoupment or forfeiture of awards upon the occurrence of certain specified events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For information regarding TSYS existing clawback policy, see Recoveries on page 35.
