sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion of the federal income tax consequences of awards granted under the 2017 Plan is intended only as a summary of the present federal income tax treatment of awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These laws are highly technical and are subject to change at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary does not discuss the tax consequences of a participants death, or the provisions of the income tax laws of any municipality, state or foreign country in which a participant may reside.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified stock options granted under the 2017 Plan will not be taxable to a participant at grant but generally will result in taxation at exercise, at which time the participant will recognize ordinary income in an amount equal to the difference between the options exercise price and the fair market value of a share of TSYS common stock on the exercise date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS will be entitled to deduct a corresponding amount as a business expense in the year the participant recognizes this income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    53
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will generally not recognize ordinary income on receipt or exercise of an ISO so long as he or she has been an employee of TSYS or its subsidiaries from the date the ISO was granted until three months before the date of exercise; however, the amount by which the fair market value of the shares of TSYS common stock on the exercise date exceeds the exercise price is an adjustment in computing the participants alternative minimum tax in the year of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant holds the shares of TSYS common stock received on exercise of the ISO until at least one year after the date of exercise (and for at least two years from the date of grant of the ISO), any difference between the amount realized upon the disposition of the shares and the amount paid for the shares will be treated as long-term capital gain (or loss, if applicable) to the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant exercises an ISO and satisfies these holding period requirements, TSYS may not deduct any amount in connection with the ISO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant exercises an ISO but engages in a disqualifying disposition by selling the shares acquired on exercise before the expiration of the one and two-year holding periods described above, the participant generally will recognize ordinary income (for regular income tax purposes only) in the year of the disqualifying disposition equal to the excess, if any, of the fair market value of the shares on the date of exercise over the exercise price; and any excess of the amount realized on the disposition over the fair market value on the date of exercise will be taxed as long- or short-term capital gain (as applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, however, the fair market value of the shares on the date of the disqualifying disposition is less than on the date of exercise, the participant will recognize ordinary income equal only to the difference between the amount realized on the disqualifying disposition and the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In either event, TSYS will be entitled to deduct an amount equal to the amount constituting ordinary income to the participant in the year of the disqualifying disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that the requirements of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are met, there are no immediate tax consequences to a participant when a SAR is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a participant exercises a SAR, the participant will recognize ordinary income equal to the amount of cash and the fair market value of any shares received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS will be entitled to deduct the same amount as a business expense in the same year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recognition of income from an award of restricted stock for federal income tax purposes depends on the restrictions imposed on the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, taxation will be deferred until the first taxable year the shares are no longer subject to substantial risk of forfeiture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the restrictions lapse, the participant will recognize ordinary income equal to the then fair market value of the stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participant may, however, make an election to include the value of the shares in gross income in the year of award despite such restrictions; in such case, any subsequent appreciation of the shares will be treated as a capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, TSYS will be entitled to deduct the fair market value of the shares transferred to the participant as a business expense in the year, and in the same amount, that the participant includes the compensation in income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a participant will not recognize ordinary income until common stock, cash, or other property becomes payable under the RSU, even if the award vests in an earlier year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS will generally be entitled to deduct the amount the participant includes in income as a business expense in the year of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Unit/Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a participant will not incur any income tax liability upon the initial grant of performance units or performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the performance or measurement period, however, the participant will realize ordinary income on any amounts received in cash or shares of TSYS common stock, and any subsequent appreciation will be treated as a capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent the performance units and performance shares are qualified performance-based compensation under Section 162(m), such awards will be deductible by TSYS when the employee recognizes ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash-Based Awards/Other Stock-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any cash payments or the fair market value of any shares of TSYS common stock or other property a participant receives in connection with cash-based awards or other stock-based awards are includable in income in the year received or made available to the participant without substantial limitations or restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, TSYS will be entitled to deduct the amount the participant includes in income as a business expense in the year of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No award is intended to be deferred compensation subject to Section 409A unless and to the extent the Committee specifically determines otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards have been granted under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards granted under the 2017 Plan will be made in the discretion of the Committee and, accordingly, are not yet determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, benefits under the 2017 Plan will depend on a number of factors, including the fair market value of our shares on future dates and the exercise decisions made by the participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, it is not possible to determine the benefits that might be received by participants under the 2017 Plan.

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires TSYS officers and directors, and persons who own more than ten percent of TSYS stock, to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership on Forms 3, 4 and 5 with the SEC.

sentences.text: To TSYS knowledge, based solely on its review of such reports submitted to TSYS, and written representations from certain reporting persons that no Forms 5 were required for those persons, TSYS believes that during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to its officers, directors and greater than ten percent beneficial owners were complied with, except that one transaction was reported late on one report for Mr. Blanchard and for Ms. Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 56    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is being made available or mailed to TSYS shareholders beginning on or about March 15, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TSYS Board of Directors is soliciting proxies to be used at the 2017 Annual Meeting of TSYS Shareholders which will be held on April 27, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time in the TSYS Riverfront Campus Auditorium, One TSYS Way, Columbus, Georgia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies are solicited to give all shareholders of record an opportunity to vote on matters to be presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who Can Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are entitled to vote if you were a shareholder of record of TSYS stock as of the close of business on February 17, 2017, the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares can be voted at the meeting only if you are present or represented by a valid proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quorum and Shares Outstanding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the outstanding shares of TSYS stock must be present, either in person or represented by proxy, in order to conduct the Annual Meeting of TSYS Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 17, 2017, 183,354,641 shares of TSYS stock were outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has designated two individuals to serve as proxies to vote the shares represented by proxies at the Annual Meetin of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and properly submit a proxy card or submit a proxy by telephone or via the Internet but do not specify how you want your shares to be voted, your shares will be voted by the designated proxies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of all of the director nominees (Proposal 1);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as TSYS independent auditor for the year 2017 (Proposal 2)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of TSYS named executive officers (Proposal 3);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1 YEAR, with respect to the advisory vote on the frequency (every one, two or three years) of future advisory votes to approve the compensation of TSYS named executive officers (Proposal 4); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval of TSYS 2017 Omnibus Plan (Proposal 5).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The designated proxies will vote in their discretion on any other matter that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this time, we are unaware of any matters, other than as set forth above, that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting of Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of TSYS stock represented at the Annual Meeting is entitled to one vote on each matter properly brought before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares entitled to vote and represented in person or by valid proxies received by phone, Internet or mail will be voted at the Annual Meeting in accordance with the instructions indicated on those proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    57
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Required Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Directors (Proposal 1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws provide a majority vote standard for uncontested director elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be elected, directors must receive a majority of the votes cast (the number of shares voted for a director nominee must exceed the number of votes cast against that nominee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If shareholders do not elect a nominee who is serving as a director, Georgia law provides that the director would continue to serve on the Board as a hold over director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines, an incumbent director that is not elected is expected to tender, promptly following certification of the voting results, his or her resignation from the Board, which resignation may be conditioned on Board acceptance of the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that the Board will nominate for election and appoint to Board vacancies only those candidates who have agreed to tender, promptly following the failure to receive the required vote for election to the Board, an irrevocable resignation that will be effective upon Board acceptance of the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee will consider the tendered resignation and recommend to the Board whether to accept or reject the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will act on the tendered resignation within 90 days from the certification of the voting results and promptly publicly disclose its decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director who tenders his or her resignation will not participate in the Committees recommendation or the Board action regarding whether to accept or reject the tendered resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other Proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast is also needed to ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP as TSYS independent auditor for 2017 (Proposal 2), approve the advisory vote on the compensation of TSYS named executive officers (Proposal 3) and approve TSYS 2017 Omnibus Plan (Proposal 5).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes (every one, two or three years) to approve the compensation of TSYS named executive officers (Proposal 4) is a plurality vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS will consider shareholders to have expressed a non-binding preference for the frequency option that receives the most votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and Broker Non-Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under certain circumstances, banks, brokers or other nominees are prohibited from exercising discretionary authority for beneficial owners who have not provided voting instructions to the bank, broker or other nominee (a broker non-vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these cases, and in cases where the shareholder abstains from voting on a matter, those shares will be counted for the purpose of determining if a quorum is present, but will not be included as votes cast with respect to those matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether a bank, broker or other nominee has authority to vote its shares on uninstructed matters is determined by the rules of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that banks, brokers and other nominees will be able to exercise discretionary authority to vote on Proposal 2, but will not have discretion to vote on Proposals 1, 3, 4 and 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, if you do not provide voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee, your bank, broker or other nominee may only vote your shares on Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of any of the Proposals to be voted on at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How You Can Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares in your own name, you may vote by proxy or in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to vote your shares in person at our Annual Meeting, you may either bring your proxy card or Notice of Internet Availability to the meeting or request a ballot at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote by proxy, you may select one of the following options:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote By Internet
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote your shares on the Internet until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on April 26, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The website for Internet voting is shown on your proxy card or Notice of Internet Availability, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet voting is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be given the opportunity to confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote on the nternet, you do NOT need to return your proxy card if you received one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can also vote your shares on the Internet by scanning the QR code shown on your proxy card or Notice of Internet Availability, as applicable, with your mobile device.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 58    TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote By Telephone
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote your shares by telephone until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on April 26, 2017 by calling the toll-free telephone number (at no cost to you) shown on your proxy card or Notice of Internet Availability, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone voting is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Easy-to-follow voice prompts allow you to vote your shares and confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our telephone voting procedures are designed to authenticate the shareholder by using individual control numbers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote by telephone, you do NOT need to return your proxy card if you received one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote By Mail
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received your proxy materials by mail, simply mark your proxy card, date and sign it, and return it in the postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in the name of a bank, broker or other nominee, you will receive instructions from your bank, broker or other nominee that you must follow for your shares to be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please follow their instructions carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, please note that if the holder of record of your shares is a broker, bank or other nominee and you wish to vote in person at the Annual Meeting, you must request a legal proxy from your bank, broker or other nominee that holds your shares and present that proxy and proof of identification at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revocation of Proxy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares in your own name and vote by proxy, you may revoke that proxy at any time before it is voted at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may do this by: (1) signing another proxy card with a later date and returning it to us prior to the Annual Meeting; (2) voting again by telephone or on the Internet before 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on April 26, 2017; or (3) attending the Annual Meeting in person and casting a ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your TSYS shares are held by a bank, broker or other nominee, you must follow the instructions provided by the bank, broker or other nominee if you wish to change your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attending the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting will be held on Thursday, April 27, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time in the TSYS Riverfront Campus Auditorium, One TSYS Way, Columbus, Georgia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directions to the auditorium can be obtained on our website at http://annualreport.tsys.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposals and Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for a shareholder proposal to be considered for inclusion in TSYS Proxy Statement for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, the written proposal must be received by the Corporate Secretary of TSYS at the address below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary must receive the proposal no later than November 15, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal will also need to comply with the SECs regulations under Rule 14a-8 regarding the inclusion of shareholder proposals in company sponsored proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals should be addressed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Secretary Total System Services, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One TSYS Way Columbus, Georgia 31901
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a shareholder proposal that is not intended to be included in TSYS Proxy Statement for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, or if you want to nominate a person for election as a director, you must provide written notice to the Corporate Secretary at the address above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretary must receive this notice not earlier than December 28, 2017 and not later than January 27, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice of a proposed item of business must provide information as required in the bylaws of TSYS which, in general, require that the notice include for each matter a brief description of the matter to be brought before the meeting; the reason for bringing the matter before the meeting; your name, address, and number of shares you own beneficially or of record; any material interest you have in the proposal; and a representation that you are a shareholder of record entitled to vote at the meeting and that you intend to appear in person or by proxy at the meeting to bring the matter before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice of a proposed director nomination must provide information as required in the bylaws of TSYS which, in general, require that the notice of a director nomination include your name, address and the number of shares you
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS  -  2017 Proxy Statement    59
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: own beneficially or of record; a representation that you are a shareholder of record entitled to vote at the meeting and that you ntend to appear in person or by proxy at the meeting to nominate the person or persons named in the notice; any arrangements between you and each proposed nominee and any other person pursuant to which the nomination is being made; the name, age, business address, residence address and principal occupation of the nominee; and the number of shares owned beneficially or of record by the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It must also include the information that would be required to be disclosed in the solicitation of proxies for the election of a director under federal securities laws.

sentences.text: You must submit the nominees consent to be elected and to serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the bylaw requirements will be provided upon request to the Corporate Secretary at the address above.

sentences.text: Financial Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed financial information for TSYS and its subsidiaries for its 2016 fiscal year is included in TSYS 2016 Annual Report that is being provided to TSYS shareholders together with this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Report and this Proxy Statement are also posted to our website at http://annualreport.tsys.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicitation of Proxies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS will pay the cost of soliciting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may be solicited on behalf of TSYS by directors, officers or employees by mail, in person or by telephone, facsimile or other electronic means.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS will reimburse brokerage firms, nominees, custodians and fiduciaries for their out-of-pocket expenses for forwarding proxy materials to beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, TSYS has retained D.F. King & Co., Inc. to assist in the solicitation of proxies for a fee of $12,500, plus reimbursement of reasonable out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SECs proxy rules permit companies and intermediaries, such as brokers and banks, to satisfy delivery requirements for proxy statements with respect to two or more shareholders sharing the same address by delivering a single proxy statement to those shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This method of delivery, often referred to as householding, should reduce the amount of duplicate nformation that shareholders receive and lower printing and mailing costs for companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSYS and certain intermediaries are householding proxy materials for shareholders of record in connection with the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only one Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or Proxy Statement and Annual Report will be delivered to multiple shareholders sharing an address unless you notify us or your broker or bank to the contrary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can contact TSYS by calling (706) 644-6081 or by writing Senior Director of Investor Relations, Total System Services, Inc., P.O. Box 2567, Columbus, Georgia 31902 to request a separate copy of the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or Annual Report and Proxy Statement for the Annual Meeting and for future meetings or, if you are currently receiving multiple copies, to receive only a single copy in the future or you can contact your bank or broker to make a similar request; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can request delivery of a single copy of the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials, Annual Report or Proxy Statements from your bank or broker if you share the same address as another TSYS shareholder and your bank or broker has determined to household proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The above Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement are sent by Order of the TSYS Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishment, Purpose and Duration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.1 Establishment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total System Services, Inc., a Georgia corporation, establishes an incentive compensation plan to be known as the Total System Services, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Plan, as set forth in this document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan permits the grant of various forms of equity- and cash-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan shall become effective upon shareholder approval (the Effective Date) and shall remain in effect as provided in Section 1.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan and each Award granted hereunder are conditioned on and shall be of no force or effect until this Plan is approved by the shareholders of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.2 Purpose of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of this Plan is to foster and promote the long-term financial success of the Company by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) motivating superior performance by means of performance-related incentives,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) encouraging and providing for the acquisition of an ownership interest in the Company by Participants, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) enabling the Company to attract and retain qualified and competent persons as employees of the Company and to serve as members of the Board and whose judgment, interest and performance are required for the successful operations of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.3 Duration of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless sooner terminated as provided herein, this Plan shall terminate ten (10) years after the Effective Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After this Plan is terminated, no Awards may be granted but Awards previously granted shall remain outstanding in accordance with their applicable terms and conditions and this Plans terms and conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.4 Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective as of the Effective Date, the Total System Services, Inc. 2012 Omnibus Plan (the Prior Plan), will be frozen and no further awards will be issued thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards issued pursuant to the Prior Plan shall remain outstanding and shall be administered in accordance with the terms of the Prior Plan and applicable award agreements thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Definitions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whenever used in this Plan, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below, and when the meaning is intended, the initial letter of the word shall be capitalized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.1 Affiliate shall mean any corporation or other entity (including, but not limited to, a partnership or a limited liability company) that is affiliated with the Company through stock or equity ownership or otherwise, and is designated as an Affiliate for purposes of this Plan by the Committee; provided that with respect to a grant of Options or Stock Appreciation Rights under Sections 6 and 7 respectively, Affiliate means any corporation or other entity (including, but not limited to, a partnership or a limited liability company) in which the Company has at least a 50% equity ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.2 Award means a grant under this Plan of Nonqualified Stock Options, Incentive Stock Options, Stock Appreciation Rights, Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Performance Shares, Performance Units, Cash-Based Awards or Other Stock-Based Awards, in each case subject to the terms of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.3 Award Agreement means a written or electronic agreement entered into by the Company and a Participant, or a written or electronic statement issued by the Company to a Participant, which in either case contains (either expressly or by reference to this Plan or any subplan created hereunder) the terms and provisions applicable to an Award granted under this Plan, including any amendment or modification thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide for the use of electronic, Internet or other non- paper Award Agreements, and the use of electronic, Internet or other non-paper means for the acceptance thereof and actions thereunder by a Participant (including, but not limited to, the use of electronic signatures).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.4 Beneficial Owner shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Rule 13d-3 of the General Rules and Regulations under the Exchange Act and the terms Beneficial Ownership and Beneficially Own shall have the corresponding meanings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.5 Board means the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.6 Cash-Based Award means an Award, denominated in cash, granted to a Participant as described in Section 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.7 A Change in Control means, except as may otherwise be provided in an Award Agreement, the occurrence of any one of the following events:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the acquisition by any Person (other than the Company or a Subsidiary or any Company employee benefit plan (including its trustee)), of Beneficial Ownership, directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing 30% or more of the total number of shares of the Companys then outstanding securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) individuals who, as of April 27, 2017, constitute the Board (the Incumbent Board) cease for any reason to constitute at least a majority of the Board; provided, however, that any individual becoming a Director subsequent to the date hereof whose election, or nomination for election by the Companys shareholders, was approved by a vote of at least two-thirds (2/3) of the Directors then comprising the Incumbent Board shall be considered as though such individual were a member of the Incumbent Board, but excluding, for this purpose, any such individual whose initial assumption of office occurs as a result of an actual or threatened election contest with respect to the election or removal of Directors or other actual or threatened solicitation of proxies or consents by or on behalf of a Person other than the Board; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) consummation of a reorganization, merger or consolidation or sale or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets or stock of the Company (a Business Combination), in each case, unless, following such Business Combination,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) all or substantially all of the individuals and entities who were the Beneficial Owners, respectively, of the total number of shares of the Companys outstanding securities immediately prior to such Business Combination Beneficially Own, directly or indirectly, more than fifty percent (50%) of the total number of shares of the then outstanding securities of the corporation resulting from such Business Combination (including, without limitation, a corporation which as a result of such transaction owns the Company or all or substantially all of the Companys assets either directly or through one or more subsidiaries) in substantially the same proportions as their ownership of the total number of shares of the Companys outstanding securities immediately prior to such Business Combination,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) no Person (excluding any corporation resulting from such Business Combination, or any employee benefit plan (including its trustee) of the Company or such corporation resulting from such Business Combination) Beneficially Owns, directly or indirectly, 30% or more of, respectively, the total number of shares of the then outstanding securities of the corporation resulting from such Business Combination except to the extent that such ownership existed prior to the Business Combination and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) at least a majority of the members of the board of directors of the corporation resulting from such Business Combination were Directors of the Company immediately prior to the signing of the agreement providing for such Business Combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, to the extent that any Award constitutes a deferral of compensation subject to Code Section 409A, and if that Award provides for a change in the time or form of payment based upon a Change in Control, then, solely for purposes of applying such change in the time or form of payment provision, a Change in Control shall be deemed to have occurred upon an event described in Section 2.7 only if the event would also constitute a change in ownership or effective control of, or a change in ownership of a substantial portion of the assets of, the Company under Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Change of Control shall not result from any transaction precipitated by the Companys insolvency, appointment of a conservator, or determination by a regulatory agency that the Company is insolvent, nor from any transaction initiated by the Company in regard to converting from a publicly traded company to a privately held company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.8 Code means the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Plan, references to sections of the Code shall be deemed to include references to any applicable regulations thereunder and any successor or similar provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.9 Commission means the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.10 Committee means the Compensation Committee of the Board or a subcommittee thereof or any other committee designated by the Board to administer this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Committee shall be appointed from time to time by and shall serve at the discretion of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee does not exist or cannot function for any reason, the Board may take any action under this Plan that would otherwise be the responsibility of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Committee shall be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an independent director within the meaning of the rules and regulations of the New York Stock Exchange (or such other national securities exchange which is the principal market on which the Shares are then traded),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a non-employee director within the meaning of Exchange Act Rule 16b-3, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) an outside director for purposes of Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.11 Company means Total System Services, Inc., and any successor thereto as provided in Section 22.21.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.12 Covered Employee means a Participant designated by the Committee at or prior to the time an Award is granted to him or her hereunder who is or is likely to become a covered employee as defined in Code Section 162(m) and for whom such Award has been designated as Performance-Based Compensation in accordance with Section 15.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.13 Director means any individual who is a member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.14 Dividend Equivalent has the meaning set forth in Section 18.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.15 Effective Date has the meaning set forth in Section 1.1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.16 Employee means any individual performing services for the Company or a Subsidiary or Affiliate and designated as an employee of the Company, the Affiliate or the Subsidiary on its payroll records.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Employee shall not include any individual during any period he or she is classified or treated by the Company, Affiliate or Subsidiary as an independent contractor, a consultant or an employee of an employment, consulting or temporary agency or any other entity other than the Company, Affiliate or Subsidiary, without regard to whether such individual is subsequently determined to have been, or is subsequently retroactively reclassified, as a common-law employee of the Company, Affiliate or Subsidiary during such period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.17 Exchange Act means the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.18 Exercise Price means the price at which a Share may be purchased by a Participant pursuant to an Option
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.19 Fair Market Value means, as applied to a specific date and unless otherwise specified in an Award Agreement, the price of a Share that is equal to the closing price of a Share on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) (or, on such other national securities exchange that is the primary trading market for the Shares, if Shares are not then listed on the NYSE) on the date of determination, or if no sales of Shares shall have occurred on such exchange on the date of determination, the closing price of the Shares on such exchange on the most recent date on which the Shares were publicly traded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, if Shares are not traded on any established stock exchange, the Fair Market Value means the price of a Share as established by the Committee acting in good faith based on a reasonable valuation method that is consistent with the requirements of Code Section 409A and the regulations thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.20 Grant Date means the date an Award to a Participant pursuant to this Plan is approved by the Committee (or such later date as specified in such approval by the Committee) or, in the case of an Award granted to a Non-employee Director, the date on which such Award is approved by the Board (or such later date as specified in such approval by the Board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.21 Grant Price means the per Share price established at the time of grant of a SAR pursuant to Section 7.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.22 Incentive Stock Option or ISO means an Award granted pursuant to Section 6 that is designated as an Incentive Stock Option and that is intended to meet the requirements of Code Section 422 or any successor provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.23 Non-employee Director means a Director who is not an Employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.24 Nonqualified Stock Option means an Award granted pursuant to Section 6 that is not intended to meet the requirements of Code Section 422, or that otherwise does not meet such requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.25 Option means an Award consisting of a right granted to a Participant pursuant to Section 6 to purchase a specified number of Shares at a specified price, which Award may be an Incentive Stock Option or a Nonqualified Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.26 Other Stock-Based Award means an equity-based or equity-related Award not otherwise described by the terms o his Plan that is granted pursuant to Section 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.27 Participant means any eligible individual as set forth in Section 5 to whom an Award is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.28 Performance-Based Compensation with respect to Covered Employees, means compensation under an Award that is intended to satisfy the requirements of Code Section 162(m) for certain performance-based compensation paid to Covered Employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Plan shall be construed to mean that an Award that does not satisfy the requirements for performance-based compensation under Code Section 162(m) does not constitute performance-based compensation for other purposes, including Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.29 Performance Measures means measures, as described in Section 15.2, upon which performance goals are based and that are approved by the Companys shareholders pursuant to this Plan in order to qualify Awards as Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.30 Performance Period means the period of time during which pre-established performance goals must be met in order to determine the degree of payout and/or vesting with respect to an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.31 Performance Shares means an Award granted pursuant to Section 10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.32 Performance Unit means an Award granted pursuant to Section 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.33 Period of Restriction means the period when Restricted Stock or Restricted Stock Units are subject to a vesting requirement (based on continued service, the achievement of performance goals or upon the occurrence of other events as determined by the Committee, in its discretion) as provided in Sections 8 and 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.34 Person shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section 3(a)(9) of the Exchange Act and used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) thereof, including a group as defined in Section 13(d) thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.35 Plan means this Total System Services, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Plan, as the same may be amended from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.36 Restricted Stock means Shares issued to a Participant that are subject to an Award granted pursuant to Section 8 and to such restrictions on transfer, forfeiture conditions and other restrictions or limitations as may be set forth in this Plan and the applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.37 Restricted Stock Unit means the right under an Award granted pursuant to Section 9 to receive at a future time one Share, or the Fair Market Value thereof, subject to such restrictions on transfer, forfeiture conditions and other restrictions or limitations as may be set forth in this Plan and the applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.38 Share means a share of common stock, par value $0.10 per share, of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.39 Stock Appreciation Right or SAR means the right under an Award granted pursuant to Section 7 to receive, in cash and/or Shares as determined by the Committee, an amount equal to the appreciation in value of a specified number of Shares between the Grant Date of the SAR and its exercise date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.40 Subsidiary means any corporation or other entity, whether domestic or foreign, in which the Company has or obtains, directly or indirectly, ownership of more than 50% of the total combined voting power of all classes of stock or comparable interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.41 Substitute Award means an Award granted upon the assumption of, or in substitution or exchange for, outstanding awards granted by a company or other entity acquired by the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate or with which the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate combines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.42 Termination of Service means the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) for an Employee, the date on which the Employee is no longer an Employee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) for a Non-employee Director, the date on which the Non-employee Director is no longer a member of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to any payment of an Award subject to Code Section 409A, a Termination of Service shall mean a separation from service within the meaning of Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.1 General.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall be responsible for administering this Plan, subject to this Section 3 and the other provisions of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may employ attorneys, consultants, accountants, agents and other individuals, any of whom may be an Employee, and the Committee, the Company, and its officers and Directors shall be entitled to rely upon the advice, opinions or valuations of any such individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All actions taken and all interpretations and determinations made by the Committee shall be final and binding upon the Participants, the Company or Subsidiary, and all other interested individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any action of the Committee shall be valid and effective even if the members of the Committee at the time of such action are later determined not to have satisfied all of the criteria for membership in clauses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) of Section 2.10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.2 Authority of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to any express limitations set forth in this Plan, the Committee shall have full and exclusive discretionary power and authority to take such actions as it deems necessary and advisable with respect to the administration of this Plan including, but not limited to, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) To determine from time to time which of the persons eligible under this Plan shall be granted Awards, when and how each Award shall be granted, what type or combination of types of Awards shall be granted, the provisions of each Award granted (which need not be identical), including the time or times when a person shall be permitted to receive Shares pursuant to an Award and the number of Shares subject to an Award;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) To construe and interpret this Plan and Awards granted under it, and to establish, amend, and revoke rules and regulation for its administration;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) To correct any defect, omission or inconsistency in this Plan or in an Award Agreement, in a manner and to the extent it shall deem necessary or expedient to make this Plan fully effective;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) To approve forms of Award Agreements for use under this Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) To determine the Fair Market Value of a Share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) To amend any Award Agreement as permitted under this Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) To adopt sub-plans and/or special provisions applicable to stock awards regulated by the laws of a jurisdiction other than and outside of the United States, to Cash-Based Awards, or to awards to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors (as contemplated by Section 16).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such sub-plans and/or special provisions shall be subject to and consistent with the terms of this Plan, except to the extent the Committee determines that different terms and conditions are necessary or desirable to comply with the laws of a jurisdiction other than and outside of the United States;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) To authorize any person to execute on behalf of the Company any instrument required to effect the grant of an Award;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) To determine whether Awards will be settled in Shares of common stock, cash or in any combination thereof;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) To determine whether Awards will provide for Dividend Equivalents;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) To establish a program whereby Participants designated by the Committee may reduce compensation otherwise payable in cash in exchange for Awards under this Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) To authorize a program permitting eligible Participants to surrender outstanding Awards in exchange for newly granted Awards subject to any applicable shareholder approval requirements set forth in Section 21.1 of this Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) To impose such restrictions, conditions or limitations as it determines appropriate as to the timing and manner of any resales by a Participant or other subsequent transfers by a Participant of any Shares, including, without limitation, restrictions under an insider trading policy and restrictions as to the use of a specified brokerage firm for such resales or other transfers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) To waive any restrictions, conditions or limitations imposed on an Award at the time the Award is granted or at any time thereafter including but not limited to forfeiture, vesting and treatment of Awards upon a Termination of Service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o) To permit Participants to elect to defer payments of Awards; provided that any such deferrals shall comply with applicabl requirements of the Code, including Code Section 409A; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p) To certify the satisfaction of performance goals for purposes of satisfying the requirements of Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.3 Delegation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by law, the Committee may delegate to one or more of its members or to one or more officers of the Company or any Subsidiary or to one or more agents or advisors such administrative duties or powers as it may deem advisable, and the Committee or any individuals to whom it has delegated duties or powers as aforesaid may employ one or more individuals to render advice with respect to any responsibility the Committee or such individuals may have under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by applicable law and the applicable rules of a stock exchange, the Committee may, by resolution, authorize one or more officers of the Company to do one or both of the following on the same basis as can the Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) designate Employees to be recipients of Awards; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) determine the size of any such Awards; provided, however,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Committee shall not delegate such responsibilities to any such officer for Awards granted to a Non-employee Director, an Employee who is considered a Covered Employee, or an officer (as defined in Rule 16a-1(f) of the Exchange Act);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the resolution providing such authorization sets forth the total number of Awards such officer(s) may grant; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the officer(s) shall report periodically to the Committee regarding the nature and scope of the Awards granted pursuant to the authority delegated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Subject to This Plan and Maximum Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.1 Number of Shares Authorized and Available for Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment as provided under Section 4.4, the total number of Shares that may be the subject of Awards and issued under this Plan shall be 15,000,000 Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such Shares may be authorized and unissued Shares or treasury Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any of the authorized Shares may be used for any type of Award under this Plan, and any or all of the Shares may be allocated to Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solely for the purpose of determining the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: number of Shares available for Awards under this Section 4.1, the number of shares available for issuance under this Plan shall be reduced by one (1.00) Share for every one (1.00) Share granted in respect of an Award, provided however that in the case of an Award that provides for a range of potential Share payouts the Committee shall determine the extent to which the number of Shares available for issuance under this Plan shall be reduced by Shares granted in respect of such an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.2 Share Usage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the number of Shares available for grant under this Plan at any time, the following rules shall apply:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Any Shares subject to an Award granted under this Plan or the Prior Plan that on or after the Effective Date terminates by expiration, forfeiture, cancellation or otherwise without the issuance of the Shares (or with the forfeiture of Shares in connection with a Restricted Stock Award), is settled in cash in lieu of Shares, or is exchanged with the Committees permission, prior to the issuance of Shares, for an Award not involving Shares shall become available again for grant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Any Shares that are withheld by the Company or tendered by a Participant (by either actual delivery or attestation) on or after the Effective Date
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to pay the Exercise Price of an Option granted under this Plan or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) to satisfy tax withholding obligations associated with an Award granted under this Plan, shall not become available again for grant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Any Shares that were subject to a stock-settled SAR granted under this Plan that were not issued upon the exercise of such SAR on or after the Effective Date shall not become available again for grant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Any Shares that were purchased by the Company on the open market with the proceeds from the exercise of a Stock Option shall not become available again for grant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Shares subject to Substitute Awards shall not be counted against the share reserve specified in Section 4.1, nor shall the reduce the Shares authorized for grant to a Participant in any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.3 Annual Award Limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment as set forth in Section 4.4, the following limits (each an Annual Award Limit and, collectively, Annual Award Limits) shall apply to grants of such Awards under this Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) The maximum aggregate number of Shares for which Options or SARs may be granted to any Participant in any calendar year shall be 4,000,000 Shares (for avoidance of the doubt, this limit applies, in the aggregate, to all Awards subject to this paragraph (a)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The maximum aggregate number of Shares that may be subject to Awards of Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Performance Shares and Other Stock Based Awards that are Performance-Based Compensation and granted to any one Participant in any calendar year shall be 2,000,000 Shares or its cash equivalent, determined as of the date of payment (for avoidance of doubt, this limit applies, in the aggregate, to all forms of Awards subject to this paragraph (b)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing maximum shall apply to any Performance Period that is equal to a fiscal year, which maximum shall be adjusted to the corresponding fraction or multiple of that amount for any Performance Period of a different duration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) The maximum aggregate amount that may be paid to any Participant in any calendar year under an Award of Performance Units, Cash-Based Awards or any other Award that is payable or denominated in cash, in each case that is Performance- Based Compensation, shall be $6,000,000 determined as of the date of payout (for avoidance of doubt, this limit applies in the aggregate, to all forms of Awards subject to this paragraph (c)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing maximum shall apply to any Performance Period that is equal to a fiscal year, which maximum shall be adjusted to the corresponding fraction or multiple of that amount for any Performance Period of a different duration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any form of Award subject to this Section 4.3(c) is to be settled in Shares, either pursuant to the discretion of the Committee or an election by the applicable Participant, compliance with the limit established by this Section 4.3(c) shall be determined by calculating the dollar value of the Shares to be issued in settlement based on the Fair Market Value of such Shares as of the applicable vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.4 Adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Awards shall be subject to the following provisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) In the event of any equity restructuring (within the meaning of FASB ASC Topic 718 or any successor provision) that causes the per share value of Shares to change, such as a stock dividend, stock split, reverse stock split, split up, spin-off, rights offering or recapitalization through an extraordinary dividend, the Committee, in order to prevent dilution or enlargement of Participants rights under this Plan, shall substitute or adjust, as applicable,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number and kind of Shares or other securities that may be issued under this Plan or under particular forms of Award Agreements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the number and kind of Shares or other securities subject to outstanding Awards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Exercise Price or Grant Price applicable to outstanding Awards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the Annual Award Limits, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) other value determinations applicable to outstanding Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of any other change in corporate capitalization (including, but not limited to, a merger, consolidation, any reorganization (whether or not such reorganization comes within the definition of such term in Code Section 368), or any partial or complete liquidation of the Company to the extent such events do not constitute equity restructurings or business combinations within the meaning of FASB ASC Topic 718 or any successor provision, such equitable adjustments described in the foregoing sentence may be made as determined to be appropriate and equitable by the Committee to prevent dilution or enlargement of rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In either case, any such adjustment shall be conclusive and binding for all purposes of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise determined by the Committee, the number of Shares subject to an Award shall always be a whole number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) In addition to the adjustments required and permitted under paragraph
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) above, the Committee, in its sole discretion, may make such other adjustments or modifications in the terms of any Awards that it deems appropriate to reflect any of the events described in Section 4.4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a), including, but not limited to,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) modifications of performance goals and changes in the length of Performance Periods, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the substitution of other property of equivalent value (including, without limitation, cash, other securities and securities of entities other than the Company that agree to such substitution) for the Shares available under this Plan or the Shares covered by outstanding Awards, including arranging for the assumption, or replacement with new awards, of Awards held by Participants, but in either case only to the extent permitted by Code Section 162(m) with respect to Awards intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in connection with any sale of a Subsidiary, arranging for the assumption, or replacement with new awards, of Awards held by Participants employed by the affected Subsidiary by the Subsidiary or an entity that controls the Subsidiary following the sale of such Subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Any actions taken under section 4.4 shall be subject to compliance with the rules under Code Sections 409A, 422 and 424, as and where applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The determination of the Committee as to the foregoing adjustments set forth in this Section 4.4, if any, shall be conclusive and binding on Participants under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.5 Effect of Plans Operated by Acquired Companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a company acquired by the Company or any Subsidiary or with which the Company or any Subsidiary combines has shares available under a pre-existing plan approved by shareholders and not adopted in contemplation of such acquisition or combination, the shares available for grant pursuant to the terms of such pre-existing plan (as adjusted, to the extent appropriate, using the exchange ratio or other adjustment or valuation ratio or formula used in such acquisition or combination to determine the consideration payable to the holders of common stock of the entities party to such acquisition or combination) may be used for Awards under this Plan and shall not reduce the Shares authorized for grant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards using such available shares shall not be made after the date awards or grants could have been made under the terms of the pre-existing plan, absent the acquisition or combination, and shall only be made to individuals who were not Employees or Non-employee Directors prior to such acquisition or combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility and Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.1 Eligibility to Receive Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals eligible to participate in this Plan shall be limited to Employees and Non- employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.2 Participation in this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the provisions of this Plan, the Committee may, from time to time, select from all individuals eligible to participate in this Plan, those individuals to whom Awards shall be granted and shall determine, in its sole discretion, the nature of any and all terms permissible by law and the amount of each Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.3 Award Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the exclusive authority to determine the terms of an Award Agreement evidencing an Award granted under this Plan, subject to the provisions herein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of an Award Agreement need not be uniform among all Participants or among similar types of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.1 Grant of Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, Options may be granted to Participants covering such number of Shares, and upon such terms, and at any time and from time to time as shall be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of an Option shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement, which shall specify whether the Option is in the form of a Nonqualified Stock Option or an Incentive Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.2 Exercise Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exercise Price for each Option shall be determined by the Committee and shall be specified in the Award Agreement evidencing such Option; provided, however, the Exercise Price must be at least equal to 100% of the Fair Market Value of a Share as of the Options Grant Date, except in the case of Substitute Awards (to the extent consistent with Code Section 409A and, in the case of Incentive Stock Options, Code Section 424), and subject to adjustment as provided for under Section 4.4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.3 Term of Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of an Option granted to a Participant shall be determined by the Committee; provided, however, no Option shall be exercisable later than the tenth anniversary of its Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.4 Exercise of Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Option shall be exercisable at such times and be subject to such restrictions and vesting conditions as the Committee shall in each instance approve, which terms and restrictions need not be the same for each grant or for each Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.5 Payment of Exercise Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Option shall be exercised by the delivery of a notice of exercise to the Company or an agent designated by the Company in a form specified or accepted by the Committee, or by complying with any alternative procedures that may be authorized by the Committee, setting forth the number of Shares with respect to which the Option is to be exercised, accompanied by full payment for the Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares issued upon exercise of an Option are subject to the transfer restrictions set forth in Section 14.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A condition of the issuance of the Shares as to which an Option shall be exercised shall be the payment of the Exercise Price and the payment of applicable withholding taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exercise Price of any exercised Option shall be payable to the Company in accordance with one of the following methods:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) In cash or its equivalent,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) By tendering (either by actual delivery or by attestation) previously acquired Shares having an aggregate Fair Market Value at the time of exercise equal to the Exercise Price (subject to such procedures and conditions as the Committee may establish),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) By a cashless (broker-assisted) exercise,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) By authorizing the Company to withhold Shares otherwise issuable upon the exercise of the Option having an aggregate Fair Market Value at the time of exercise equal to the Exercise Price to the extent approved by the Committee,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) By any combination of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d), or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) By any other method approved or accepted by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise determined by the Committee, all payments under all of the methods indicated above shall be paid in United States dollars or Shares, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.6 Special Rules Regarding ISOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any provision of this Plan to the contrary, an Option granted in the form of an ISO to a Participant shall be subject to the following rules:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) An incentive stock option may be granted only to an Employee of the Company or of any parent or subsidiary corporation (within the meaning of Code Section 424).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) An Option will constitute an Incentive Stock Option only to the extent that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) it is so designated in the applicable Award Agreement and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the aggregate Fair Market Value (determined as of the Options Grant Date) of the Shares with respect to which Incentive Stock Options held by the Participant first become exercisable in any calendar year (under this Plan and all other plans of the Company and its Affiliates) does not exceed $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent an Option granted to a Participant exceeds this limit, the Option shall be treated as a Nonqualified Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) No Participant may receive an Incentive Stock Option under this Plan if, immediately after the grant of such Award, the Participant would own (after application of the rules contained in Code Section 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)) Shares possessing more than 10% of the total combined voting power of all classes of stock of the Company or an Affiliate, unless
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the exercise price for that Incentive Stock Option is at least 110% of the Fair Market Value of the Shares subject to that Incentive Stock Option on the Grant Date and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) that Option will expire no later than five years after its Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) If an Incentive Stock Option is exercised after the expiration of the exercise periods that apply for purposes of Code Section 422, such Option shall thereafter be treated as a Nonqualified Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 7.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.1 Grant of SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, SARs may be granted to Participants in such number, and upon such terms, and at any time and from time to time as shall be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of SARs shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.2 Grant Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Grant Price for each grant of a SAR shall be determined by the Committee and shall be specified in the Award Agreement evidencing the SAR; provided, however, the Grant Price must be at least equal to 100% of the Fair Market Value of a Share as of the Grant Date, except in the case of Substitute Awards (to the extent consistent with Code Section 409A), and subject to adjustment as provided for under Section 4.4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.3 Term of SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of a SAR granted to a Participant shall be determined by the Committee; provided, however, no SAR shall be exercisable later than the tenth anniversary of its Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.4 Exercise of SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A SAR shall be exercisable at such times and be subject to such restrictions and vesting conditions as the Committee shall in each instance approve, which terms and restrictions need not be the same for each grant or for each Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.5 Notice of Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A SAR shall be exercised by the delivery of a notice of exercise to the Company or an agent designated by the Company in a form specified or accepted by the Committee, or by complying with any alternative procedures that may be authorized by the Committee, setting forth the number of Shares with respect to which the SAR is to be exercised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.6 Settlement of SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the exercise of a SAR, pursuant to a notice of exercise properly completed and submitted to the Company in accordance with Section 7.5, a Participant shall be entitled to receive payment from the Company in an amount equal to the product of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) The excess of the Fair Market Value of a Share on the date of exercise over the Grant Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The number of Shares with respect to which the SAR is exercised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment shall be made in cash, Shares or a combination thereof as provided for under the applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares issued in payment of a SAR are subject to the transfer restrictions set forth in Section 14.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.1 Grant of Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, Restricted Stock Awards may be granted to Participants in such number of Shares, and upon such terms, and at any time and from time to time as shall be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of Restricted Stock shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.2 Nature of Restrictions.
