sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of Restricted Stock may be subject to a requirement that a Participant pay a stipulated purchase price for each Share of Restricted Stock, and shall be subject to a Period of Restriction that shall lapse upon the satisfaction of such vesting conditions as are determined by the Committee and set forth in an applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such conditions or restrictions may include, without limitation, one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) That the Shares of Restricted Stock may not be transferred in any fashion prior to their applicable vesting date
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: b) That the Shares of Restricted Stock may vest only to the degree that specific performance goals are achieved,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) That the Shares of Restricted Stock may vest only upon completion of a specified period of continuous employment or other service and to the degree that specific performance goals have been achieved, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) That the Shares of Restricted Stock may vest only upon completion of a specified period of continuous employment or other service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.3 Delivery of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested Shares subject to a Restricted Stock Award shall be evidenced by a book-entry in the name of the Participant with the Companys transfer agent or Plan agent or by one or more stock certificates issued in the name of the Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such stock certificate shall be deposited with the Company or its designee, together with an assignment separate from the certificate, in blank, signed by the Participant, and bear an appropriate legend referring to the restricted nature of the Restricted Stock evidenced thereby.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any book-entry Shares shall be subject to comparable restrictions and corresponding stop transfer instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the vesting of Shares of Restricted Stock, and the Companys determination that any necessary conditions precedent to the release of vested Shares (such as satisfaction of tax withholding obligations and compliance with applicable legal requirements) have been satisfied, such vested Shares shall be made available to the Participant in such manner as may be prescribed or permitted by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such vested Shares are subject to the transfer restrictions set forth in Section 14.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.4 Voting Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As set forth in a Participants applicable Award Agreement, the Committee shall determine the extent to which a Participant holding Shares of Restricted Stock shall be granted the right to exercise full voting rights with respect to those Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.5 Section 83(b) Election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide in an Award Agreement that the Award of Restricted Stock is conditioned upon the Participant making or refraining from making an election with respect to the Award under Code Section 83(b).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a Participant makes an election pursuant to Code Section 83(b) concerning a Restricted Stock Award, the Participant shall be required to file promptly a copy of such election with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.6 Certificate Legend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to any legends placed on certificates pursuant to Section 8.3, each certificate representing Shares of Restricted Stock granted pursuant to this Plan may bear a legend such as the following or as otherwise determined by the Committee in its sole discretion:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The transferability of this certificate and the shares of stock represented hereby are subject to the terms and conditions (including forfeiture) of the Total System Services, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Plan and a Restricted Stock Award Agreement entered into between the registered owner and Total System Services, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of such Plan and Agreement are on file in the offices of Total System Services, Inc., One TSYS Way, Columbus, Georgia 31901.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.1 Grant of Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, Restricted Stock Units may be granted to Participants in such number, and upon such terms, and at any time and from time to time as shall be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A grant of Restricted Stock Units shall not represent the grant of Shares but shall represent a promise to deliver a corresponding number of Shares or the value of such number of Shares based upon the completion of service, performance conditions, or such other terms and conditions as specified in the applicable Award Agreement over the Period of Restriction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of Restricted Stock Units shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.2 Nature of Restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of Restricted Stock Units shall be subject to a Period of Restriction that shall lapse upon the satisfaction of such vesting conditions as are determined by the Committee and set forth in an applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such conditions or restrictions may include, without limitation, one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) That the Restricted Stock Units may not be transferred in any fashion, subject to Section 14.1,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) That the Restricted Stock Units may vest only to the degree that specific performance goals are achieved,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) That the Restricted Stock Units may vest only upon completion of a specified period of continuous employment or othe service and to the degree that specific performance goals have been achieved, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) That the Restricted Stock Units may vest only upon completion of a specified period of continuous employment or other service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.3 Voting Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Participant shall have no voting rights with respect to any Restricted Stock Units granted hereunder or the Shares subject to any Restricted Stock Units granted hereunder prior to the issuance of the Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.4 Settlement and Payment of Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise elected by the Participant as permitted under the Award Agreement, or otherwise provided for in the Award Agreement, Restricted Stock Units shall be settled upon the date such Restricted Stock Units vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such settlement shall be made in Shares unless otherwise specified in the Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares issued in settlement of Restricted Stock Units are subject to the transfer restrictions set forth in Section 14.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.1 Grant of Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, Performance Shares may be granted to Participants in such number, and upon such terms and at any time and from time to time as shall be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of Performance Shares shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.2 Value of Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Performance Share shall have a value equal to the Fair Market Value of a Share on the Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall set performance goals that, depending on the extent to which they are met over the specified Performance Period and the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: satisfaction of applicable service-based vesting conditions, shall determine the number of Performance Shares that shall vest, which may be greater than the target number of Performance Shares granted, and be paid to a Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.3 Earning of Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the applicable Performance Period has ended, the number of Performance Shares earned by the Participant for the Performance Period shall be determined as a function of the extent to which the applicable corresponding performance goals have been achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This determination shall be made by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10.4 Form and Timing of Payment of Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall pay at the close of the applicable Performance Period, or as soon as practicable thereafter, any earned Performance Shares in the form of Shares unless otherwise specified in the Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares issued in settlement of Performance Shares are subject to the transfer restrictions set forth in Section 14.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.1 Grant of Performance Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, Performance Units may be granted to a Participant in such number, and upon such terms and at any time and from time to time as shall be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each grant of Performance Units shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.2 Value of Performance Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Performance Unit shall have an initial notional value equal to a dollar amount determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall set performance goals in its discretion that, depending on the extent to which they are met over the specified Performance Period and the satisfaction of applicable service-based vesting conditions, will determine the number of Performance Units that shall vest (which may be greater than the target number of Performance Units granted), the settlement value of each Performance Unit (if variable), and the settlement amount to be paid to the Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.3 Earning of Performance Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the applicable Performance Period has ended, the number of Performance Units earned by the Participant over the Performance Period shall be determined as a function of the extent to which the applicable corresponding performance goals have been achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This determination shall be made by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11.4 Form and Timing of Payment of Performance Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall pay at the close of the applicable Performance Period, or as soon as practicable thereafter, any earned Performance Units in the form of cash or in Shares or in a combination thereof, as specified in a Participants applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares issued in settlement of Performance Units are subject to the transfer restrictions set forth in Section 14.3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Stock-Based Awards and Cash-Based Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12.1 Grant of Other Stock-Based Awards and Cash-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, the Committee may grant Other Stock-Based Awards not otherwise described by the terms of this Plan to a Participant in such amounts and subject to such terms and conditions, as the Committee shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such Awards may involve the transfer of actual Shares to Participants, or payment in cash or otherwise of amounts based on the value of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The Committee may grant Cash-Based Awards not otherwise described by the terms of this Plan to a Participant in such amounts and upon such terms as the Committee shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Each grant of Other Stock-Based Awards and Cash-Based Awards shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement and/or subject to a subplan or special provisions approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12.2 Value of Other Stock-Based Awards and Cash-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Other Stock-Based Award shall be expressed in terms of Shares or units based on Shares, as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Cash-Based Award shall specify a payment amount or payment range as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee exercises its discretion to establish performance goals, the number and/or value of Cash-Based Awards or Other Stock-Based Awards that shall be paid to the Participant will depend on the extent to which such performance goals are met and any service-based payment conditions are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12.3 Payment of Other Stock-Based Awards and Cash-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment, if any, with respect to Cash-Based Awards and Other Stock-Based Awards shall be made in accordance with the terms of the applicable Award Agreement in the form of cash, Shares or other forms of Awards under this Plan or a combination of cash, Shares and other forms of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The determination of the form in which Awards subject to this Section 12 will be paid shall be made by the Committee, unless the Committee chooses to provide in an applicable Award Agreement that a Participant may elect, in accordance with such procedures and limitations as the Committee may specify, the form in which such an Award will be paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent any Award subject to this Section 12 is to be paid in other forms of Awards under this Plan, such Awards issued in payment shall be valued for purposes of such payment at their Fair Market Value on the Grant Date of such Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee permits a Participant to elect to receive some or all of an amount that would otherwise be payable in cash under an Award subject to this Section 12 in Shares or other forms of Awards, the Committee may also provide in the applicable Award Agreement that the Fair Market Value of the Shares or the Grant Date fair value of the other forms of Awards may exceed the amount of cash that otherwise would have been payable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 13.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Termination of Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Award Agreement evidencing the grant of an Award shall provide for the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) The extent to which a Participant shall vest in or forfeit such Award as a result of or following the Participants Termination of Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) With respect to an Award in the form of an Option or SAR, the extent to which a Participant shall have the right to exercise the Option or SAR following the Participants Termination of Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing provisions shall be determined by the Committee, shall be included in each Award Agreement entered into with each Participant, need not be uniform among all Award Agreements and may reflect distinctions based on the reasons for termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transferability of Awards and Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14.1 Transferability of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as provided in Section 14.2, Awards shall not be transferable other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution or, subject to the consent of the Committee, pursuant to a domestic relations order entered into by a court of competent jurisdiction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Awards shall be subject, in whole or in part, to attachment, execution or levy of any kind; and any purported transfer in violation of this Section 14.1 shall be null and void.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may establish such procedures as it deems appropriate for a Participant to designate a beneficiary to whom any amounts payable or Shares deliverable in the event of, or following, the Participants death may be provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14.2 Committee Action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may, in its discretion, approve a Participants transfer, by gift, of an Award (except in the case of an ISO), on such terms and conditions as the Committee deems appropriate and to the extent permissible with Code Section 409A and applicable securities laws,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to an Immediate Family Member (as defined below) of the Participant,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) to an inter vivos or testamentary trust in which the Award is to be passed to the Participants designated beneficiaries, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) to a charitable institution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any transferee of the Participants rights shall succeed and be subject to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all of the terms of the applicable Award Agreement and this Plan, including restrictions on further transferability, compliance with applicable securities laws, and providing required investment representations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Immediate Family Member means any child, stepchild, grandchild, parent, stepparent, grandparent, spouse, former spouse, sibling, niece, nephew, mother-in-law, father-in-law, son-in-law, daughter-in-law, brother-in-law, or sister-in-law, including adoptive relationships, a trust in which any of these persons have more than fifty (50%) percent of the beneficial interest, a foundation in which any of these persons (or the Participant) control the management of assets, and any other entity in which these persons (or the Participant) own more than fifty (50%) percent of the voting interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14.3 Restrictions on Share Transferability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may impose such restrictions on any Shares acquired by a Participant under this Plan as it may deem advisable, including, without limitation, minimum holding period requirements, restrictions under applicable federal securities laws, under the requirements of any stock exchange or market upon which such Shares are then listed or traded or under any blue sky or state securities laws applicable to such Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 15.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Compensation and Compliance with Code Section 162(m)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15.1 Compliance with Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to Section 15.5, the provisions of this Plan are intended to ensure that all Options and SARs granted hereunder to any Participant who is a Covered Employee at the time of exercise of such Option or SAR qualify for exemption from the limitation on deductibility imposed by Code Section 162(m) and that such Options and SARs shall therefore be considered Performance-Based Compensation and this Plan shall be interpreted and operated consistent with that intention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may designate any Award (other than an Option or SAR) as Performance-Based Compensation upon grant, in each case based upon a determination that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Participant is designated a Covered Employee with respect to such Award, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Committee wishes such Award to be subject to this Section 15 and qualify for exemption from the limitation on deductibility imposed by Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the sole authority to specify which Awards are to be granted in compliance with this Section 15 and treated as Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15.2 Performance Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance goals upon which the grant, payment or vesting of an Award to a Covered Employee that is intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation are conditioned must be based on one or more of the following Performance Measures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Assets,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Cash flow (including, but not limited to, operating cash flow, free cash flow, cash flow return on equity, and cash flow return on investment),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Customer satisfaction,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Earnings per share,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Earnings before or after either, or any combination of, interest, taxes, depreciation, or amortization,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) Economic value added (net operating profit after tax minus the sum of capital multiplied by the cost of capital),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) Expenses/costs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) Gross or net earnings or income,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Gross or net operating margins,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) Gross or net operating profits,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) Gross or net sales or revenues,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) Individual objective performance measures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) Market share,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) Net earnings or net income (before or after taxes),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o) Number of cardholder, merchant and/or other customer accounts processed or converted,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p) Operating efficiency,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q) Productivity ratios and measures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (r) Return measures (including, but not limited to, return on assets, total assets employed, equity, capital, invested capital, sales or revenues),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (s) Share price (including, but not limited to, growth in share price and total shareholder return),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (t) Strategic business objectives (including objective project milestones),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (u) Successful negotiation or renewal of contracts with new or existing customers,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) Transactions relating to acquisitions or divestitures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (w) Unit volume, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) Working capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Performance Measure(s) may, as the Committee, in its sole discretion deems appropriate,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) relate to the performance of the Company, any Affiliate or any Subsidiary as a whole or any business unit, division or segment of the Company, any Affiliate or any Subsidiary or any combination thereof,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) be compared to the performance of a group of comparator companies, or published or special index,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) be based on change in the Performance Measure over a specified period of time and such change may be measured based on an arithmetic change over the specified period (e.g., cumulative change or average change), or percentage change over the specified period (e.g., cumulative percentage change, average percentage change or compounded percentage change),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) relate to or be compared to one or more other Performance Measures, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) any combination of the foregoing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent consistent with the requirements of Code Section 162(m), the Committee also has the authority to provide for accelerated vesting of any Award based on the achievement of performance goals pursuant to the Performance Measures specified in this Section 15.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to a particular Performance Period, the Committee, in its sole discretion, shall, within the first 90 days of a Performance Period (or, if longer or shorter, within the maximum period allowed under Section 162(m) of the Code), determine the length of the Performance Period (provided any such Performance Period shall be not less than one fiscal quarter in duration), the type(s) of Performance-Based Compensation Awards to be issued, and the Performance Measures that will be used to establish the performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the completion of a Performance Period, the Committee shall review and certify in writing whether, and to what extent, the performance goals for the Performance Period have been achieved and, if so, calculate and certify in writing the amount of the Performance-Based Compensation Awards earned for the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15.3 Evaluation of Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide in any Award intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation that any evaluation of performance may include or exclude the impact, if any, on reported financial results of, among other things, any of the following events that occurs during a Performance Period:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) asset write-downs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) litigation, claims, judgments or settlements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) changes in tax laws, accounting principles or other laws or provisions,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) reorganization or restructuring programs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) acquisitions or divestitures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) foreign exchange gains and losses or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) gains and losses that are treated as unusual in nature or infrequent in their occurrence and which are disclosed in managements discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations appearing in the Companys annual report to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such inclusions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or exclusions shall be prescribed in a form and at a time that meets the requirements of Code Section 162(m) for qualification of the Award as Performance-Based Compensation unless the Committee exercises its discretion pursuant to Section 15.5 that such Award not satisfy the requirements of Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15.4 Adjustment of Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have no discretion to increase the amount payable pursuant to Awards that are intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation beyond the amount that would otherwise be payable upon attainment of the applicable performance goal(s).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall, however, retain the discretion to decrease the amount payable pursuant to such Awards below the amount that would otherwise be payable upon attainment of the applicable performance goal(s), either on a formula or discretionary basis or any combination, as the Committee determines, in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15.5 Committee Discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that applicable tax or securities laws change to permit Committee discretion to alter the governing Performance Measures or permit flexibility with respect to the terms of any Award or Awards to be treated as Performance-Based Compensation without obtaining shareholder approval of such changes, the Committee shall have sole discretion to make such changes without obtaining shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in the event that the Committee determines that it is advisable to grant Awards that are not intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation, the Committee may make such grants without satisfying the requirements of Code Section 162(m) and base vesting on Performance Measures other than those set forth in Section 15.2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15.6 Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent the Committee issues any Award that is intended to be exempt from the deduction limitation of Code Section 162(m), the Committee may, without shareholder or grantee approval, amend this Plan or the relevant Award Agreement retroactively or prospectively to the extent it determines necessary in order to comply with any subsequent clarification of Code Section 162(m) required to preserve the Companys federal income tax deduction for compensation paid pursuant to any such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee Director Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 16.1 Awards to Non-employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board shall approve all Awards to Non-employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms and conditions of any grant of any Award to a Non-employee Director shall be set forth in an Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 16.2 Awards in Lieu of Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may permit a Non-employee Director the opportunity to receive an Award in lieu of payment of all or a portion of future director fees (including but not limited to cash retainer fees and meeting fees) or other type of Awards pursuant to such terms and conditions as the Board may prescribe and set forth in an applicable sub-plan or Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board permits a Participant to elect to receive payment of all or a portion of future director fees that would otherwise be payable in cash in the form of an Award, the Board may also provide in the applicable Award Agreement that the Grant Date fair value of the Award may exceed the amount of cash that otherwise would have been payable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 16.3 Annual Award Limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-based Awards granted to Non-employee Directors shall be subject to the following limitations:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Subject to paragraphs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) below, the maximum aggregate fair value as of the Grant Date of equity-based Awards granted to any Non-employee Director during any calendar year shall not exceed $400,000, with fair value determined under applicable accounting standards (Annual Non-employee Director Award Limit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The Annual Non-employee Director Award Limit shall be increased to $600,000 for any Non-employee Director who serves as Chairman of the Board or Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) The Annual Non-employee Director Award Limit shall be increased to $600,000 for any Non-employee Director for the year in which the Non-employee Director is first appointed or elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the avoidance of doubt, the annual award limit set forth in this Section 16.3 shall solely apply to Awards granted under this Plan and shall not apply to Shares or Share equivalents granted to a Non-employee Director in lieu of all or any portion of such Non-employee Directors cash-based director fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 17.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17.1 Default Vesting Provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise provided for in an Award Agreement, and except to the extent that an Award meeting the requirements of Section 17.2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) (a Replacement Award) is provided to the Participant pursuant to Section 4.4 to replace an existing Award (the Replaced Award), upon a Change in Control, all then-outstanding Awards shall vest in accordance with paragraphs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Outstanding Options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a Change in Control, a Participants then-outstanding Options and SARs that are not vested shall immediately become fully vested (and, to the extent applicable, all performance conditions shall be deemed satisfied at target performance) and, subject to Section 17.3, exercisable over the exercise period set forth in the applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Outstanding Awards, other than Options and SARs, Subject Solely to a Service Condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a Change in Control, subject to Section 17.3, a Participants then-outstanding Awards, other than Options and SARs, that are not vested and as to which vesting depends solely on the satisfaction of a service obligation by the Participant to the Company or any Subsidiary shall become fully vested and shall be settled in cash, Shares or a combination thereof as provided for under the applicable Award Agreement within thirty (30) days following such Change in Control (except to the extent that settlement of the Award must be made pursuant to its original schedule in order to comply with Code Section 409A).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Outstanding Awards, other than Options and SARs, Subject to a Performance Condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a Change in Control, subject to Section 17.3, a Participants then-outstanding Awards, other than Options and SARs, that are not vested and as to which vesting depends upon the satisfaction of one or more performance conditions shall immediately vest and all performance conditions shall be deemed satisfied as if target performance was achieved and shall be settled pro rata, based on the proportion of the applicable performance period that lapsed through the date of the Change of Control, in cash, Shares or a combination thereof as provided for under the applicable Award Agreement within thirty (30) days following such Change in Control (except to the extent that settlement of the Award must be made pursuant to its original schedule in order to comply with Code Section 409A); notwithstanding that the applicable performance period, retention period or other restrictions and conditions have not been completed or satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17.2 Definition of Replacement Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) An Award shall meet the conditions of this Section 17.2(a) (and hence qualify as a Replacement Award) if:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) it is of the same type as the Replaced Award (or, it is of a different type as the Replaced Award, provided that the Committee, as constituted immediately prior to the Change in Control, finds such type acceptable);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) it has an intrinsic value at least equal to the value of the Replaced Award;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) it relates to publicly traded equity securities of the Company or its successor in the Change in Control or another entity that is affiliated with the Company or its successor following the Change in Control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) its terms and conditions comply with Section 17.2(b); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) its other terms and conditions are not less favorable to the holder of the Award than the terms and conditions of the Replaced Award (including the provisions that would apply in the event of a subsequent Change in Control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Replacement Award may take the form of a continuation of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Replaced Award if the requirements of the preceding sentence are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The determination of whether the conditions of this Section 17.2(a) are satisfied shall be made by the Committee, as constituted immediately before the Change in Control, in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Committee may determine the value of Awards and Replacement Awards that are stock options or stock appreciation rights by reference to either their intrinsic value or their fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Upon an involuntary termination of service of a Participant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) by the Company other than for Cause, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) to the extent specifically permitted in the Participants Award Agreement, a termination by the Participant for good reason (as defined in the Participants Award Agreement, change of control agreement or employment agreement, as applicable), in either case occurring within two years following the Change in Control, unless otherwise specified in the award agreement and approved by the Committee as constituted prior to the Change in Control, all Replacement Awards held by the Participant shall become fully vested and free of restrictions and, in the case of Replacement Awards in the form of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) stock options or stock appreciation rights shall be fully exercisable,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) performance-based Awards shall be deemed to be satisfied at target level performance and paid pro rata (based upon the proportion of the applicable performance period that has lapsed through the date of the Participants involuntary termination of service) upon or within 60 days of such termination of service, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (z) service- based Awards (other than stock options or stock appreciation rights) shall be paid upon or within 60 days of such termination of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, with respect to any Award that is considered deferred compensation subject to Code Section 409A, settlement of such Award shall be made pursuant to its original schedule if necessary to comply with Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Section 17.2(b), Cause shall mean:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Participant is a party to an employment, service or change in control agreement with the Company or its Affiliates and such agreement provides for a definition of Cause, the definition contained therein, or if no such agreement exists, or if such agreement does not define Cause, (1) the commission of, or plea of guilty or no contest to, a felony or a crime involving moral turpitude or the commission of any other act involving willful malfeasance or material fiduciary breach with respect to the Company or an Affiliate; (2) conduct that results in or is reasonably likely to result in harm to the reputation or business of the Company or any of its Affiliates; (3) gross negligence or willful misconduct with respect to the Company or an Affiliate; (4) the willful and continued failure to perform substantially the Participants duties with the Company or one of its Affiliates; or (5) a material violation of state or federal securities laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17.3 Cashout of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Unless otherwise provided for in an Award Agreement, in the event of a Change in Control, with respect to any outstanding Option or Stock Appreciation Right, the Committee shall have discretion to cause a cash payment to be made to the person who then holds such Option or Stock Appreciation Right, in lieu of the right to exercise such Option or Stock Appreciation Right or any portion thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the Committee exercises its discretion to cause such cash payment to be made, the amount of such cash payment shall be equal to the amount by which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the aggregate fair market value (on the date of the Change in Control) of the Shares that are subject to such Option or Stock Appreciation Right exceeds
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the aggregate Exercise Price or Grant Price (as applicable) of such Shares under such Option or Stock Appreciation Right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the aggregate air market value (on the date of the Change in Control) of the Shares that are subject to such Option or Stock Appreciation Right is less than the aggregate Exercise Price or Grant Price (as applicable) of such Shares under such Option or Stock Appreciation Right, such Option or Stock Appreciation Right shall be cancelled without any payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Unless otherwise provided for in an Award Agreement, in the event of a Change in Control, with respect to an Award (other than an Option or Stock Appreciation Right) that would otherwise be payable in Common Shares, the Committee shall have discretion to cause the payment of such Award to be made in cash instead of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the Committee exercises its discretion to cause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: such cash payment to be made, the amount of such cash payment shall be equal to the aggregate fair market value, on the date of the Change in Control, of the Shares that would otherwise then be payable under such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 18.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends and Dividend Equivalents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 18.1 Payment of Dividends on Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to an Award of Restricted Stock, the Committee may grant or limit the right of a Participant to receive dividends declared on Shares that are subject to such Award to the extent the Award is not yet vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee grants the right of a Participant to receive dividends declared on Shares subject to an unvested Award of Restricted Stock, then such dividends shall be paid to the Participant as of the applicable dividend payment dates or such other dates as determined by the Committee and set forth in the applicable Award Agreement; provided however, that in the case of an Award of Restricted Stock as to which vesting depends upon the satisfaction of one or more performance conditions, such dividends shall be subject to the same performance conditions and service conditions, as applicable, as the underlying Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends shall be paid in cash or reinvested in additional Shares or Awards by such formula and at such time and subject to such limitations as may be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 18.2 Payment of Dividend Equivalents on Awards Other than Options, SARs and Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for Options, SARs and Restricted Stock, the Committee may grant Dividend Equivalents on the units or other Share equivalents subject to an Award based on the dividends actually declared and paid on outstanding Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of any Dividend Equivalents will be as set forth in the applicable Award Agreement, including the time and form of payment and whether such Dividend Equivalents will be credited with interest or deemed to be reinvested in additional units or Share equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend Equivalents payable with respect to the unvested portion of an Award whose vesting depends upon the satisfaction of one or more performance conditions shall be subject to the same performance conditions and service conditions, as applicable, as the underlying Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 19.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficiary Designation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Participant under this Plan may, from time to time, name any beneficiary or beneficiaries (who may be named contingently or successively) to whom any benefit under this Plan is to be paid in case of his death before he or she receives any or all of such benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each such designation shall revoke all prior designations by the same Participant, shall be in a form prescribed by the Committee, and will be effective only when filed by the Participant in writing, including electronically, with the Company during the Participants lifetime.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of any such beneficiary designation, benefits remaining unpaid or ights remaining unexercised at the Participants death shall be paid to or exercised by the Participants executor, administrato or legal representative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 20.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rights of Participants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.1 Employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in this Plan or an Award Agreement shall
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) interfere with or limit in any way the right of the Company or any Subsidiary to terminate any Participants employment with the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate at any time or for any reason not prohibited by law or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) confer upon any Participant any right to continue his employment or service as a Director for any specified period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither an Award nor any benefits arising under this Plan shall constitute an employment contract with the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate and, accordingly, subject to Sections 3 and 21, this Plan and the benefits hereunder may be amended or terminated at any time in the sole and exclusive discretion of the Board or Committee without giving rise to any liability on the part of the Company, any Subsidiary, any Affiliate, the Committee or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.2 Participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No individual shall have the right to be selected to receive an Award under this Plan, or, having been so selected, to be selected to receive a future Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20.3 Rights as a Shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as otherwise provided herein, a Participant shall have none of the rights of a shareholder with respect to Shares covered by any Award until the Participant becomes the record holder of such Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 21.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment and Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21.1 Amendment and Termination of this Plan and Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Subject to subparagraphs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) of this Section 21.1 and Section 21.3 of this Plan, the Board may at any time amend, suspend or terminate this Plan, and the Board or Committee may at any time amend, suspend or terminate any outstanding Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Without the prior approval of the Companys shareholders and except as provided for in Section 4.4, no Option or SAR Award may be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) amended to reduce the Exercise Price or the Grant Price thereof, as applicable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) cancelled in exchange for the grant of any new Option or SAR with a lower Exercise Price or Grant Price, as applicable; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) cancelled in exchange for cash, other property or the grant of any new Award at a time when the Exercise Price of the Option or the Grant Price of the SAR is greater than the current Fair Market Value of a Share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Notwithstanding the foregoing, no amendment of this Plan shall be made without shareholder approval if shareholder approval is required pursuant to rules promulgated by any stock exchange or quotation system on which Shares are listed or quoted or by applicable U.S. state corporate laws or regulations, or applicable U.S. federal laws or regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21.2 Adjustment of Awards Upon the Occurrence of Certain Unusual or Nonrecurring Events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Except as may be limited by Code Section 162(m) with respect to Awards intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation, the Committee may make adjustments in the terms and conditions of, and the criteria included in, Awards in recognition of unusual or nonrecurring events (including, without limitation, the events described in Section 4.4) affecting the Company or the financial statements of the Company or of changes in applicable laws, regulations, or accounting principles, whenever the Committee determines that such adjustments are appropriate in order to prevent unintended dilution or enlargement of the benefits or potential benefits intended to be made available under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Any subplan may provide that the Committee or its authorized delegate shall retain the discretion to decrease the amount payable pursuant to a Cash-Based Award granted under such subplan below the amount that would otherwise be payable upon attainment of the applicable performance goal(s) over a Performance Period that does not exceed a term of one (1) year, either on a formula or discretionary basis or any combination, as the Committee or its authorized delegate determines is appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) The determination of the Committee (or its authorized delegate, if applicable) as to any adjustments made pursuant to subparagraphs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) above shall be conclusive and binding on Participants under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By accepting an Award under this Plan, a Participant agrees to any adjustment to the Award made pursuant to this Section 21.2 without further consideration or action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21.3 Awards Previously Granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan to the contrary, other than Sections 21.2 and 21.4, no termination or amendment of this Plan or an Award Agreement shall adversely affect in any material way any Award previously granted under this Plan, without the written consent of the Participant holding such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21.4 Amendment to Conform to Law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan to the contrary, the Board may amend this Plan and the Board or the Committee may amend an Award Agreement, to take effect retroactively or otherwise, as deemed necessary or advisable for the purpose of conforming this Plan or an Award Agreement to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any law relating to plans of this or similar nature (including, but not limited to Code Section 409A), and to the administrative regulations and rulings promulgated thereunder,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any applicable stock exchange requirements and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recoupment policy adopted by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By accepting an Award under this Plan, a Participant agrees to any amendment made pursuant to this Section 21.4 to this Plan and any Award without further consideration or action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21.5 Deferred Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the intention of the Company that no Award be deferred compensation subject to Code Section 409A unless and to the extent that the Committee specifically determines otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms and conditions governing any Awards that the Committee determines will be subject to Code Section 409A, including any rules for payment, including elective or mandatory deferral of the payment or delivery of cash or Shares pursuant thereto, and any rules regarding treatment of such Awards in the event of a Change in Control, shall be set forth in the applicable Award Agreement and shall be intended to comply in all respects with Code Section 409A, and this Plan, and the terms and conditions of such Awards shall be interpreted and administered accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall not extend the period to exercise an Option or Stock Appreciation Right to the extent that such extension would cause the Option or Stock Appreciation Right to become subject to Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Committee provides otherwise in an Award Agreement, each Restricted Stock Unit, Performance Unit, Performance Share, Cash-Based Award and/or Other Stock-Based Award shall be paid in full to the Participant no later than the fifteenth day of the third month after the end of the first calendar year in which such Award is no longer subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture within the meaning of Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee provides in an Award Agreement that a Restricted Stock Unit, Performance Unit, Performance Share, Cash-Based Award or Other Stock- Based Award is intended to be subject to Code Section 409A, the Award Agreement shall include terms that are intended to comply in all respects with Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Dividend Equivalents shall relate to Shares underlying an Option or SAR unless such Dividend Equivalent rights are explicitly set forth as a separate arrangement and do not cause any such Option or SAR to be subject to Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 22.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.1 Forfeiture Events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) In addition to the forfeiture events specified in paragraph
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) below, the Committee may specify in an Award Agreement that the Participants rights, payments and benefits with respect to an Award shall be subject to reduction, cancellation, forfeiture or recoupment upon the occurrence of certain specified events, in addition to any otherwise applicable treatment of an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Notwithstanding any other provisions in this Plan, any Award which is subject to recovery under any law, government regulation or stock exchange listing requirement will be subject to such deductions and clawback as may be required to be made pursuant to such law, government regulation or stock exchange listing requirement (or any policy adopted by the Company pursuant to any such law, government regulation or stock exchange listing requirement) and the Committee, in its sole and exclusive discretion, may require that any Participant reimburse the Company all or part of the amount of any payment in settlement of any Award granted hereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.2 Tax Withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Tax Withholding Generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall have the power and the right to deduct or withhold, or require a Participant to remit to the Company, an amount sufficient to satisfy applicable federal, state and local tax withholding requirements, domestic or foreign, with respect to any taxable event arising as a result of the grant, vesting, exercise or settlement of an Award to the Participant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Share Withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise required by the Committee, the Company may withhold, or permit a Participant to elect to have withheld from a Share Payment the number of Shares having a Fair Market Value equal to the minimum statutory withholding requirements but in no event shall the Participant be allowed to elect for such withholding to exceed the minimum statutory withholding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the immediately preceding sentence, the Company, in its discretion, may withhold Shares or permit a Participant to elect to have withheld from a Share Payment, the number of Shares having a Fair Market Value up to, but not in excess of, the maximum statutory withholding requirements, provided that withholding Shares with a Fair Market Value in excess of the minimum statutory withholding requirements will not result in an Award otherwise classified as an equity award under ASC Topic 718 or any successor provision to be classified as a liability award under ASC Topic 718 or any successor provision).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term Share Payment shall mean the issuance or delivery of Shares upon the grant, vesting, exercise or settlement of an Award, as the case may be.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.3 Legend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The certificates for Shares may include any legend that the Committee deems appropriate to reflect any restrictions on transfer of such Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.4 Gender and Number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except where otherwise indicated by the context, any masculine term used herein also shall include the feminine, the plural shall include the singular, and the singular shall include the plural.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.5 Severability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event any provision of this Plan shall be held illegal or invalid for any reason, the illegality or invalidity shall not affect the remaining parts of this Plan, and this Plan shall be construed and enforced as if the illegal or invalid provision had not been included.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.6 Requirements of Law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The granting of Awards and the issuance of Shares under this Plan shall be subject to all applicable laws, rules and regulations, and to such approvals by any governmental agencies or national securities exchanges as may be required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the intent of the Company that this Plan satisfy, and be interpreted in a manner that satisfies, the applicable requirements of Rule 16b-3, as promulgated under Section 16 of the Exchange Act, so that Participants will be entitled to the benefit of Rule 16b-3 (or any successor provisions) and will not be subject to short-swing liability under Section 16 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any provision of this Plan would conflict with this intent, such provision to the extent possible shall be interpreted and/or deemed amended so as to avoid such conflict.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.7 Delivery of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall have no obligation to issue or deliver Shares under this Plan prior to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Obtaining any approvals from governmental agencies that the Company determines are necessary or advisable; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Completion of any registration or other qualification of the Shares under any applicable national or foreign law or ruling of any governmental body that the Company determines to be necessary or advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.8 Inability to Obtain Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The inability of the Company to obtain authority from any regulatory body having jurisdiction, which authority is deemed by the Companys counsel to be necessary to the lawful issuance and sale of any Shares hereunder, shall relieve the Company of any liability in respect of the failure to issue or deliver such Shares as to which such requisite authority shall not have been obtained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.9 Investment Representations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may require any individual receiving Shares pursuant to an Award under this Plan to represent and warrant in writing that the individual is acquiring the Shares for investment and without any present intention to sell or distribute such Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.10 Employees Based Outside of the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any provision of this Plan to the contrary, in order to comply with the laws in other countries in which the Company or any Subsidiaries or Affiliates operate or have Employees or Directors, the Committee, in its sole discretion, shall have the power and authority to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Determine which Subsidiaries and Affiliates shall be covered by this Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Determine which Employees or Directors outside the United States are eligible to participate in this Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Modify the terms and conditions of any Award granted to Employees or Directors outside the United States to comply with applicable foreign laws;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Establish sub-plans and modify exercise procedures and other terms and procedures, to the extent such actions may b necessary or advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any sub-plans and modifications to Plan terms and procedures established under this Section 22.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by the Committee shall be attached to this Plan document as appendices; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Take any action, before or after an Award is made, that it deems advisable to obtain approval or comply with any necessary local government regulatory exemptions or approvals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the above, the Committee may not take any actions hereunder, and no Awards shall be granted, that would violate applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.11 Uncertificated Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that this Plan provides for issuance of certificates to reflect the transfer of Shares, the transfer of such Shares may be effected on a noncertificated basis, to the extent not prohibited by applicable law or the rules of any stock exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.12 Unfunded Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants shall have no right, title or interest whatsoever in or to any investments that the Company or any Subsidiaries may make to aid it in meeting its obligations under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing contained in this Plan, and no action taken pursuant to its provisions, shall create or be construed to create a trust of any kind, or a fiduciary relationship between the Company and any Participant, beneficiary, legal representative or any other individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any individual acquires a right to receive payments from the Company or any Subsidiary or Affiliate under this Plan, such right shall be no greater than the right of an unsecured general creditor of the Company or the Subsidiary or the Affiliate, as the case may be.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All payments to be made hereunder shall be paid from the general funds of the Company, or the Subsidiary or the Affiliate, as the case may be, and no special or separate fund shall be established, and no segregation of assets shall be made to assure payment of such amounts except as expressly set forth in this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.13 No Fractional Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No fractional Shares shall be issued or delivered pursuant to this Plan or any Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall determine whether cash, Awards or other property shall be issued or paid in lieu of fractional Shares or whether such fractional Shares or any rights thereto shall be forfeited or otherwise eliminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.14 Retirement and Welfare Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither Awards made under this Plan nor Shares or cash paid pursuant to such Awards may be included as compensation for purposes of computing the benefits payable to any Participant under the Companys or any Subsidiarys or Affiliates retirement plans (both qualified and nonqualified) or welfare benefit plans unless such other plan expressly provides that such compensation shall be taken into account in computing a Participants benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.15 Nonexclusivity of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption of this Plan shall not be construed as creating any limitations on the powe of the Board or Committee to adopt such other compensation arrangements as it may deem desirable for any Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.16 No Constraint on Corporate Action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in this Plan shall be construed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) limit, impair, or otherwise affect the Companys or a Subsidiarys or Affiliates right or power to make adjustments, reclassifications, reorganizations or changes of its capital or business structure, or to merge or consolidate, or dissolve, liquidate, sell or transfer all or any part of its business or assets; or,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) limit the right or power of the Company or a Subsidiary or Affiliate to take any action that such entity deems to be necessary or appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.17 Governing Law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan and each Award Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the state of Georgia excluding any conflicts or choice of law rule or principle that might otherwise refer construction or interpretation of this Plan to the substantive law of another jurisdiction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise provided in the Award Agreement, recipients of an Award under this Plan are deemed to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the federal or state courts of Georgia to resolve any and all issues that may arise out of or relate to this Plan or any related Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.18 Delivery and Execution of Electronic Documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by applicable law, the Company may
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) deliver by email or other electronic means (including posting on a website maintained by the Company or by a third party under contract with the Company) all documents relating to this Plan or any Award thereunder (including without limitation, prospectuses required by the Commission) and all other documents that the Company is required to deliver to its security holders (including without limitation, annual reports and proxy statements) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) permit Participants to electronically execute applicable Plan documents (including, but not limited to, Award Agreements) in a manner prescribed to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.19 No Representations or Warranties Regarding Tax Effect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any provision of this Plan to the contrary, the Company, Affiliates, Subsidiaries, the Board and the Committee neither represent nor warrant the tax treatment under any federal, state, local or foreign laws and regulations thereunder (individually and collectively referred to as the Tax Laws) of any Award granted or any amounts paid to any Participant under this Plan including, but not limited to, when and to what extent such Awards or amounts may be subject to tax, penalties and interest under the Tax Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.20 Indemnification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to requirements of the laws of the state of Georgia, each individual who is or shall have been a member of the Board, or a Committee appointed by the Board, or an officer of the Company or other person to whom authority was delegated in accordance with Section 3, shall be indemnified and held harmless by the Company against and from any loss, cost, liability, or expense that may be imposed upon or reasonably incurred by him or her in connection with or resulting from any claim, action, suit or proceeding to which he or she may be a party or in which he or she may be involved by reason of any action taken or failure to act under this Plan and against and from any and all amounts paid by him or her in settlement thereof, with the Companys approval, or paid by him or her in satisfaction of any judgment in any such action, suit, or proceeding against him or her, provided he or she shall give the Company an opportunity, at its own expense, to handle and defend the same before he or she undertakes to handle and defend it on his/her own behalf, unless such loss, cost, liability or expense is a result of his/her own willful misconduct or except as expressly provided by statute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing right of indemnification shall not be exclusive of any other rights of indemnification to which such individuals may be entitled under the Companys Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws, as a matter of law or otherwise, or any power that the Company may have to indemnify them or hold them harmless.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.21 Successors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All obligations of the Company under this Plan with respect to Awards granted hereunder shall be binding on any successor to the Company, whether the existence of such successor is the result of a direct or indirect purchase, merger, consolidation, or otherwise, of all or substantially all of the business and/or assets of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.22 Right of Offset.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and its Affiliates shall have the right to offset against the obligations to make payment or issue any Shares to any Participant under this Plan, any outstanding amounts (including travel and entertainment advance balances, loans, tax withholding amounts paid by the employer or amounts repayable to the Company or Affiliate pursuant to tax equalization, housing, automobile or other employee programs) such Participant then owes to the Company or an Affiliate and any amounts the Committee otherwise deems appropriate pursuant to any tax equalization policy or agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
